posts.creator: Andrew Zakonov
posts.title: Make Your Ideas Clickable With Kineto by JetBrains
posts.content:encodedSnippet:
While developing a website or an app, you‚Äôll encounter loads of technical challenges that need to be solved ‚Äì from how to code the functionality to how to host it. Delivering even a simple to-do app requires a hefty technology stack, a team of professionals, and hours of testing and maintenance. This is the reason why millions of great ideas remain little more than ideas and never end up becoming ready-to-use products.¬†
We saw it as a challenge and inspiration to develop and introduce our new product, Kineto by JetBrains ‚Äì a platform that helps create, deploy, and maintain ready-to-use websites and apps.¬†





    
Join the Waitlist
                                                    
From now on, anybody in the world will be able to effortlessly create their own personal or professional app and share it with their friends ‚Äì just as easily as our phones allow us to take pictures, record videos, and share these on social media today. Why look for an existing app when you can create your own in 20 minutes?¬†
As of yet, nobody has been able to develop technology capable of doing this: website constructors increase web development speeds, but they still require your input to actually build a website, and while there are generative AI platforms, these still need you to do some (vibe) coding. At this moment in time, there is no platform that allows people with no coding experience to build a ready-to-use app and actually enjoy the process of building it.
Now, with the release of Kineto, we have taken a significant step toward making this dream a reality.
With Kineto, we‚Äôre building a bridge between creative people, small businesses, and no-code platforms, contributing to the emergence of a creative dev economy ‚Äì a new era in which people will create their own personal web apps with minimal effort.¬†
The key principle behind Kineto is no code for you at all. We and our tools take care of the coding, so you could focus on being creative. We‚Äôve leveraged 25 years of experience building products for developers to create this technology that will help millions of people make their ideas happen ‚Äì and truly enjoy the process of creation.¬†
Today, Kineto is perfect for creating small, ‚Äúsingle value‚Äù applications. Whether we‚Äôre talking about a website, a plant care app, a fitness tracker, a personal blog, a day planner, or even a small quiz app ‚Äì you can build them all without a single line of code. Kineto will create a fully functional app with a UI, backend, and database that can all be changed through the chat interface. Kineto needs some time to create your web app ‚Äì usually it takes around 20 minutes to build the first prototype, and then it‚Äôs up to you how to improve it.
Future iterations of Kineto will bring even more complex and beautiful ideas to life, even taking care of hosting and suggesting helpful improvements to your apps along the way.¬†
Let us walk you through how Kineto works.¬†
It all starts with an idea
The first step with Kineto is to formulate the prompt with a detailed explanation of what your app should do, and what it should look like. Every prompt is processed by Kineto and translated into appropriate functionality. You don‚Äôt need to explain every single button or provide extensive references; Kineto will think of all that for you and then propose a suitable interface and design.




Kineto helps you ship your web application
It‚Äôs okay if you don‚Äôt know exactly what you want your app to look like. Kineto will ask you to choose a basic design template, color scheme, and font in order to give it a solid starting point from which to build your app.
All you need is a prompt ‚Äì and complex software architecture under the hood
All apps need a bit of fine-tuning. But you don‚Äôt want to write a new prompt every single time you need to make a minor change. This is where Kineto‚Äôs Meta Layer mode comes in ‚Äì it lets you verify and modify functionality, user roles, and rules of your app.
Preview your prototype
Your prototype will be ready in ~20 minutes ‚Äì it takes some time for Kineto to generate a fully functional website or web app. During this period, Kineto will create a complex app architecture and then build and test the right functionality based on your prompt.




Develop your app
You can add your desired features, rehash the design, embed AI-generated illustrations or your own images, and so much more. Make your ideas come to life!
Publish your website or web app
The only step left now is to publish your app, share it, and start using it. When you‚Äôre happy with how Kineto implemented your app, share it with us so we can add it to our library of apps created by Kineto.




The Early Access Program is now open
At JetBrains, we‚Äôve been building tools for professional developers, and now we want to offer our technologies to creators who‚Äôve never coded ‚Äì or even planned to.
If this describes you, we‚Äôd love for you to trial Kineto and share your experience with us. The Early Access Program is now open, and we invite you to join the waitlist to try it out for yourself. We‚Äôll review all applications and grant free access to a select group of users with no coding experience, with priority being given to those who already know what they want to create. As a participant in our Early Access Program, you won‚Äôt just receive access to Kineto ‚Äì you‚Äôll also enjoy the full support of our team, who will assist you as you build and polish your app.¬†
Our goal is to help you close Kineto happy with your app ‚Äì and hopefully welcome you back again later to make more.
Please understand that we won‚Äôt be able to provide access to all applicants in order to ensure that we can give those selected the required focus and attention.
Join us to build a creative dev future ‚Äì together.
Join the Waitlist

posts.creator: Oleg Zinovyev
posts.title: CLion 2025.2 Is Here: Better CLion Nova, Smarter Embedded Development
posts.content:encodedSnippet:
CLion 2025.2 is now available. This latest version of the JetBrains IDE for C and C++ includes the following key updates:
CLion Nova‚Äôs improved C and C++ code formatter.
Faster remote development with CLion Nova thanks to improved typing assistance.
Live watches in the debugger for monitoring global variables in real time.
ESP32 debug server designed for ESP-IDF projects.




You can download CLion 2025.2 from the link below, via the Toolbox App, as a snap package if you‚Äôre using Ubuntu, or via a patch update from version 2025.1.
DOWNLOAD CLION 2025.2
CLion Nova
Key updates to the CLion Nova language engine include:
New code formatter for clearer and more consistent coding.
A smoother experience when working remotely.
Earlier issue detection without waiting for builds to complete.
Enhanced GoogleTest support for more convenient testing.
Reworked code formatter
The old code formatter had several issues that negatively affected the user experience. Mainly, the indent size displayed by the status bar widget didn‚Äôt always match the actual indent size in the editor.
CLion Nova has an Indents Detection option, which is enabled by default. This feature automatically identifies the proper indent size based on the context of the file. This is helpful when switching between different types of files with varying indentation sizes, like source files and CMakeLists.txt. However, the widget didn‚Äôt show whether the option was enabled. As a result, if you were typing (like pressing Enter), you might see a different indent size than what you expected based on the code style settings.
For v2025.2, we‚Äôve overhauled the code formatter, the corresponding status bar widget, and the widget and settings UI. Now, the relationship between the editor‚Äôs indent size, the info in the status bar widget, and the formatter configuration in Settings | Editor | Code Style | C/C++ should be clear and consistent.
In addition, you can now configure alternative formatter options, such as ClangFormat, Indents Detection, or EditorConfig, directly from the widget, without having to do so in the settings.
EditorConfig is a new formatter available in CLion Nova. It uses a file called .editorconfig to define code styles. If you have .editorconfig in your project root, the IDE will read its properties and apply them as your default code style settings. Note that you currently need to install the corresponding plugin to use EditorConfig.
When you switch to an alternative formatter, an icon indicating which formatter is being used appears in the widget. Here‚Äôs what it looks like when ClangFormat (first slide) or Indents Detection (second slide) is enabled:
When using the native CLion formatter, you can now select the Read code style from .clang-format files option in the code style settings. The formatter will then use the formatting options from a .clang-format file as the defaults. The icon in the widget will change accordingly.
Another improvement is that, before, whenever you edited a .clang-format file, you had to save the changes and restart the editor. Now, changes apply automatically while you‚Äôre editing the file.
Faster remote development
We‚Äôve improved the performance and responsiveness of CLion Nova when working remotely. The typing assistant now runs on the thin client instead of the server. This means that, in certain situations, you won‚Äôt have to wait for the backend‚Äôs response, and that your internet connection no longer affects the IDE‚Äôs responsiveness. Features like auto-inserting paired <>, [], or () brackets, or smart indentation when the Backspace key is pressed, are now as fast as when working locally.

                        


Note that some typing assistance features have not yet been moved to the thin client, but we‚Äôre working on this.
No more missed compilation errors
Previously, CLion Nova sometimes overlooked possible compilation errors when analyzing your source code and did not show the corresponding warnings in the editor. As a result, these errors appeared only in the terminal after the build was complete. Now, CLion Nova catches all the errors before you click Build, Run, or Debug.




Improved support for GoogleTest
We‚Äôve extended the capabilities of our GoogleTest integration in CLion Nova, so that CLion Nova‚Äôs GoogleTest features now match those of CLion Classic. One of the essential features is the support for the TEST_P macro. It‚Äôs useful for parameterized tests where you need to run the same test logic with different input values. Now, you can run a parameterized test by clicking the green Run button in the gutter next to a TEST_P function.




Embedded development
For embedded development, we‚Äôve focused on two things:
Making debugging time-critical embedded systems more practical and efficient by enabling real-time monitoring of variable values.
Simplifying the configuration and debugging of ESP-IDF projects.
Live watches
The live watches feature allows you to monitor global variables in real time without stopping the program‚Äôs execution. This is especially useful for developers of embedded systems who work with time-critical protocols, such as Bluetooth or Zigbee, or with physical processes that require uninterrupted operation, like electric motor control or real-time sensor sampling.

                        


Live watchers are enabled by default. To use them, ensure that the Debug Servers option is enabled in Settings | Advanced Settings | Debugger.¬†
Note that live watches currently only work with the SEGGER J-Link and ST-LINK debug servers, or the generic server when it is connected to SEGGER J-Link or ST-LINK debug probes. You can learn more about the other current limitations in the documentation.
ESP32 debug server
In addition to the generic, SEGGER J-Link, and STM32 debug servers, you can now use one specifically designed for ESP-IDF projects. It contains only the most basic and essential settings, and everything else is preconfigured to simplify the configuration process.
Go to Settings | Build, Execution, Deployment | Debugger | Debug Servers, click +, and then select the ESP-IDF template.
Here you can configure the parameters of your debug server, device, and debugger.
If you find yourself needing more detailed configuration options, simply convert your ESP-IDF debug server into a generic one.
Other updates and improvements
CLion is now free for non-commercial use
Starting from v2025.1.1, the IDE is free for non-commercial use. This change aims to make CLion more accessible to students, hobbyists, and open-source contributors, allowing them to learn and explore without the burden of licensing fees. Read the documentation to learn how to activate your free license.
Updated project status widget
We‚Äôve improved the functionality and UI of the project status widget by making its warnings more prominent and more interactive. For example, if your file doesn‚Äôt belong to a project, you can fix this by clicking the corresponding link. You will then be able to:
Configure a CMake project
Configure a run configuration for the current file
Create a c_cpp_properties.json file




If the warning is irrelevant to your current task, you can now simply close the banner ‚Äì an option that wasn‚Äôt previously available. An example of the latter case would be if you needed to open an out-of-project file to analyze code.
Low-level exception suppression
While debugging, you can now suppress low-level exceptions triggered by __debugbreak() or inline assembly with int3. This is especially useful when debugging complex game projects because it allows you to skip the game engine‚Äôs low-level assertions that trigger manual breakpoints. This feature gives you more control over low-level exceptions and signals. You can choose when you want the debugger to stop and when it should continue debugging.
CLion and Rider share this functionality, and you can check out this blog post from the Rider team to learn more about how the feature works and how to configure it.
Bundled CMake 4.0.2
We‚Äôve updated the bundled CMake version to v4.0.2, which removed compatibility with versions older than 3.5. For example, running a project with cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.4) in a CMakeLists.txt file now causes an error. However, you can use the CMAKE_POLICY_VERSION_MINIMUM variable to configure existing projects that are based on unsupported CMake versions (learn more about the variable).
Reworked 2025 terminal becomes default
The new JetBrains terminal, which was available in Beta starting with CLion 2025.1, is now the default. After carefully analyzing user feedback and the drawbacks of the 2023‚Äì2024 terminal, we returned to a conservative baseline. Here are the key features of the reworked 2025 terminal:
JediTerm returns as the core emulator, like it was in the classic terminal. This ensures maximum compatibility with existing shell features, shortcuts, and plugins, behaving precisely like a standard external terminal.
Rendering is integrated into the IDE editor with GPU acceleration, allowing for advanced text rendering and potential UI enhancements without disrupting shell logic.
Remote development workflows are being supported as the primary mode.




However, if you prefer the classic terminal, you can switch to it in the tool‚Äôs Options | Terminal Engine.




Read the IntelliJ IDEA blog post to learn more about the new terminal and the evolution of its architecture in JetBrains IDEs.
Pre-commit checks with AI Assistant
You can now perform AI self-reviews on any commit from the log or on any changes selected in the Changes list of your Commit tool window.




These AI-powered reviews help you identify potential issues early on and review changes before submitting them for peer review, reducing the time your peers spend on it.
Try CLion and give us your feedback
We invite you to give CLion 2025.2 a try. If you have an active subscription, you can update it right away. New to CLion? Try the IDE for free if you plan to use it for non-commercial projects or for educational purposes. Otherwise, start a free 30-day trial to access all its features and improvements.
We value your feedback! If you have anything to share or if you run into any problems, please let us know through our issue tracker.
DOWNLOAD CLION 2025.2

posts.creator: Evgenia Verbina
posts.title: PyCharm 2025.2: AI Toolkit for AI Engineers and More!
posts.content:encodedSnippet:
PyCharm 2025.2 introduces the AI Toolkit: everything AI engineers need ‚Äì now natively supported in your IDE.
This release‚Äôs other highlights include the last supported version of PyCharm Community, improvements to AI Assistant, Junie, and notebooks, as well as a persistent UI for updating .lock files and other enhancements.
Download the latest version from our website or update through our free Toolbox App.¬†
Download now
                                                    
PyCharm Community is moving toward the unified PyCharm




In our efforts to make PyCharm one powerful unified product, 2025.2 will be the last supported version of PyCharm Community. With the 2025.3 release, we‚Äôll offer a seamless way to migrate to the unified PyCharm. You can upgrade to 2025.2 Community using the Toolbox App or via the in-product upgrade notification.
If you‚Äôd already like to start using the unified PyCharm with Jupyter notebooks for free today, without waiting for the migration, you can download it here. Learn more about the unified PyCharm in this blog post.
AI Toolkit [Pro]
The PyCharm AI Toolkit integrates AI development directly into PyCharm, bringing experimentation, debugging, evaluation, fine-tuning, and deployment into one familiar environment.






The AI Toolkit is just getting started, but it‚Äôs already packed with powerful features like the AI Playground and AI Agents Debugger.
Want to influence what comes next? Help shape the future of AI development tooling in PyCharm by sharing your feedback. We‚Äôre building this for you, and we prioritize the features that matter most to our community. Let us know what you‚Äôd love to see.
Learn more about the AI Toolkit
                                                    
AI Playground [Pro]
PyCharm 2025.2 introduces the versatile new AI Playground feature, which lets AI engineers compare responses from multiple AI models side by side. You can configure system prompts and fine-tune individual model parameters, enabling precise control over Temperature, Top P, and Max length parameters.¬†
Go to More Tool Windows | AI Playground, where you will be able to choose between:
All models included in your paid AI subscription (these will use your AI Assistant tokens[Experimenta]l).
Custom providers that you can add via API keys.
Locally running models.










AI Agents Debugger [Pro]
PyCharm 2025.2 also introduces the powerful new AI Agents Debugger plugin, designed to provide transparency and debugging capabilities for AI agent development. It‚Äôs built for developers working with agentic systems who need to understand, debug, and optimize their agent workflows.¬†
AI Agents Debugger transforms the typically opaque ‚Äúblack box‚Äù nature of agentic systems by providing detailed insights into the thought processes, metadata, inputs, and outputs of each agent node.





    
Learn more about the AI Toolkit
                                                    
Junie
Junie, the coding agent by JetBrains, autonomously plans, writes, refines, and tests code to make your development experience smooth, efficient, and enjoyable. It handles tedious tasks like restructuring code, creating tests, and implementing refinements, so you can focus on bigger challenges and innovation.




Junie has received several major updates, including a speed boost of up to 30%! It now features MCP support, enabling Junie to connect to external servers and deliver more accurate solutions. Additionally, Junie is now available for remote development (currently supported on macOS and Linux) and has launched an Early Access Program for its GitHub integration. This integration allows you to work with pull requests without opening the IDE.
Junie is available in PyCharm as part of the JetBrains AI subscription.¬†
Get Junie in PyCharm
                                                    
AI Assistant
Smarter completion across all supported languages, now with support for SQL, YAML, JSON, Markdown, and more.
Expanded offline flexibility ‚Äì connect any OpenAI-compatible model server like llama.cpp or LiteLLM.
JetBrains AI Assistant now supports image attachments in the chat when using Anthropic and OpenAI models.
All JetBrains AI features are available for free with PyCharm Pro subscription, with unlimited code completion, powerful local workflows, and limited cloud-based features.



    
Get started
                                                    
Persistent UI for updating .lock files
We‚Äôve added persistent controls to .toml configuration files for uv, Hatch, and Poetry. These controls allow you to apply changes made to a .toml file by clicking the corresponding buttons to sync, lock, or update the dependencies in your environment.




Context-aware code generation for Jupyter notebooks and SQL cells [Pro]
You can now generate code for Jupyter notebooks and SQL cells using AI Assistant, which considers the source cell‚Äôs context.¬†
To do so, click AI Edit Cell in the context menu or navigate to it from the AI icon in the right-hand toolbar.




Logical structure tool window for Django [Pro]
Logical structure offers a framework-centric view of your Django project, allowing you to navigate and understand your application architecture more intuitively. It represents your project based on how Django sees it ‚Äì surfacing the meaningful relationships between models, views, serializers, forms, admin classes, and other components you work with every day. It also allows you to generate templates for missing relations between entities, helping you quickly scaffold your code.¬†




With an active JetBrains AI subscription, you can unlock more advanced capabilities. Instead of basic templates, the AI generates complete code that‚Äôs fully aware of entity relationships, delivering smarter and more context-rich results.
Advanced image processing¬†
A new image viewer provides options for performing additional manipulations, including restoring the original image, inverting the channels of the original image, converting the image to grayscale, setting the binarization threshold, and more.



    
Download now
                                                    
Looking for more?
Visit our What‚Äôs New page to learn about other 2025.2 features and the latest bug fixes.
Read the release notes for the full breakdown of the changes.
If you encounter any problems, please report them via our issue tracker so we can address them promptly.
We‚Äôd love to hear your feedback on PyCharm 2025.2 ‚Äì leave your comments below or connect with us on X.

posts.creator: Paul Chapman
posts.title: Visual Studio 2015 Retirement: Support reminder for older versions of Visual Studio
posts.content:encodedSnippet:
Support for Visual Studio 2015 will end on October 14, 2025. If you‚Äôre using an older version of Visual Studio, we want to keep you productive and secure when using Visual Studio, and strongly recommend you upgrade to Visual Studio 2022, which brings the power of Copilot to your development workflow. It also contains key productivity improvements in the editor, built-in support for Git version control and rich integration with GitHub, AI-powered code completions, and tools for .NET 8 and 9, and .NET MAUI.
Support Timeframe Reminders for older versions
If you‚Äôre still using an older version of Visual Studio, here‚Äôs a reminder of key support lifecycle dates.
Visual Studio 2015 extended support ends October 14, 2025.
Visual Studio 2017 version 15.9 remains in extended support until April 13, 2027. During extended support we provide fixes only for security issues. You must be using version 15.9 to receive security updates and support.
Visual Studio 2019 version 16.11 remains in extended support through April 10, 2029. During extended support we provide fixes only for security issues. You must be using version 16.11 to receive security updates and support.
Visual Studio 2022 version 17.14 is in mainstream support through January 12, 2027, and then transitions to extended support through January 13, 2032. Additionally, version 17.10 LTSC is supported until January 13, 2026, and version 17.12 is supported until July 14, 2026. You must be on one of these versions to receive updates and support.
Visual Studio 2015 Retirement
On October 14, 2025, support will end for all Visual Studio 2015 editions, associated products, runtimes, and components, and they will no longer receive security or any other updates. These include:
Visual Studio 2015 Enterprise, Professional, Community, Build Tools, Team Explorer, Test Professional editions, and Visual Studio 2015 Shell (Integrated and Isolated).
Visual Studio SDK, Remote Tools, Agents, Feedback Client for Visual Studio Team Foundation Server 2015, Deployment Agent, Release Management, and Azure Tools.
The MSVC Tools v140 ‚Äì Visual Studio 2015. When using Visual Studio 2017 or later, update any project using MSVC v140 to use the latest MSVC toolset.
Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2015. Update your applications to use the latest release of Visual C++ Redistributable.
Check out the Visual Studio Hub
Stay connected with everything Visual Studio in one place! Visit the Visual Studio Hub for the latest release notes, YouTube videos, social updates, and community discussions.
Appreciation for your feedback
Your feedback helps us improve Visual Studio, making it an even more powerful tool for developers. We are immensely grateful for your contributions and look forward to your continued support. By sharing your thoughts, ideas, and any issues you encounter through Developer Community, you help us improve and shape the future of Visual Studio.
The post Visual Studio 2015 Retirement: Support reminder for older versions of Visual Studio appeared first on Visual Studio Blog.

posts.creator: Jessie Houghton, Oscar Obeso, Rhea Patel
posts.title: Smarter AI Edits in Visual Studio Copilot
posts.content:encodedSnippet:
When we first set out to get smarter AI edits in Visual Studio Copilot, we knew we were tackling a deeply complex problem. It wasn‚Äôt just about generating great suggestions‚Äîit was about figuring out how to seamlessly apply those suggestions to your code. While the idea seemed simple at first glance, the reality was anything but.¬† ¬†
document.createElement('video');
https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2025/07/SideBySideNewMapper.mp4

The Complexity of Implementing AI-Generated Edits¬†
Let‚Äôs¬†rewind to our early attempts. Copilot might give you a fantastic suggestion‚Äîa new method, a helpful refactor, or¬†maybe even¬†a corrected logic block. But the¬†real challenge¬†began when we tried to insert those changes into the existing file without breaking anything. Where does the edit go? What happens if the file has been updated since the suggestion was generated? What if the model‚Äôs output inadvertently introduces conflicts, overlaps existing code, or even forgets a required bracket? These questions made the process tricky, and the resulting red squiggles made it difficult to trust AI suggestions.¬†
In the early days, we approached this problem in the most straightforward way possible: brute force. We used heuristics and rule-based techniques like string matching and pattern recognition to¬†identify¬†where edits might belong. It worked‚Ä¶ kind of. The results were often inconsistent, especially for complex edits spanning multiple lines. And as Copilot‚Äôs capabilities expanded to support more languages and scenarios,¬†maintaining¬†these rules became a moving target‚Äîalways shifting, always growing harder to manage. Success rates hovered around 50%, which was far from ideal. In hindsight, it became increasingly clear that we¬†couldn‚Äôt¬†outpace the ever-evolving models with static rules.¬†¬†¬†
Better Models Meet Smarter Techniques¬†
As AI technology advanced, we saw an opportunity to revisit this problem with a fresh perspective. Two major developments in AI made it possible to rethink how we could get smarter edits in Visual Studio Copilot: modern models with larger context windows and a groundbreaking technique called speculative decoding.¬† ¬†
Speculative decoding¬†became a game changer for speeding up AI-assisted edits. It works by pairing a fast model with a more sophisticated one. The fast model generates token predictions for the edit ahead of time, while the smarter model steps in only when needed to refine or verify those predictions. This collaboration¬†improved average token generation speed¬†by 2-3x¬†and¬†made¬†it¬†feasible¬†to implement the generated edits using the model, which¬†significantly enhanced accuracy when integrating changes into your files.¬†¬†¬†
By using speculative decoding,¬†we adopted¬†the¬†model-based approach to applying edits that¬†was able to fill in the gaps that the¬†previous¬†approach could not reach.¬†Instead of relying on rule sets, we employed an¬†AI model to simulate an ‚Äúideal‚Äù version of your file with the chosen suggestions seamlessly integrated. A smart diff algorithm then compares this ideal version with your actual file to pinpoint and precisely map the edits. This allowed the entire process to handle edge cases‚Äîlike overlapping code or missing syntax‚Äîmore intelligently than ever before.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†
Balancing Accuracy¬†and Speed¬†
While speculative decoding dramatically improved performance, applying AI edits still came with a natural trade-off: using models introduced latency. Previously, all string computation was done locally, meaning edits appeared¬†almost instantly. Now, every edit¬†involved¬†network calls and token generation‚Äîa process that unfolds incrementally as a token stream, rather than as a single, instant response.¬†¬†¬†
To make this experience feel meaningful for users, we implemented a streaming animation in the editor. As edits are detected on the token stream, users see their document updating line by line in real time. This animation serves two purposes:¬†showcasing¬†progress and providing visibility into exactly how the changes are being applied. Although this approach trades the speed we had before for greater accuracy, feedback has shown that users value precision over raw speed‚Äîespecially when it comes to¬†maintaining¬†code quality and reducing disruption.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†
Looking Ahead
This work laid the foundation for‚ÄØAgent Mode‚ÄØin Visual Studio Copilot‚Äîa feature that enables the AI to not only suggest improvements but actively¬†assist¬†in executing them. For Agent Mode to function effectively, the edits needed to be precise, seamless, and reliable enough for the agent to build, debug, and test the code. Speculative decoding has already made significant strides in balancing speed and accuracy, but¬†we‚Äôre¬†not stopping there.
A faster implementation of our speculative decoding technique is on the horizon. This updated version will¬†leverage¬†advancements in token generation and model pairing to further reduce latency while¬†maintaining¬†accuracy users have come to expect. Early tests show promise of a 2-4x speed boost compared to the original rollout, moving closer to the ideal experience where precision meets near-instant response times.¬†
The post Smarter AI Edits in Visual Studio Copilot appeared first on Visual Studio Blog.

posts.content:

posts.author: Ïñ¥Îñ§Ïò§ÌõÑÏùò ÌîÑÎ¶¨Ïõ®Ïñ¥ Ïù¥ÏïºÍ∏∞
posts.content:
Ìã∞Ïä§ÌÜ†Î¶¨, ÏõåÎìúÌîÑÎ†àÏä§? ÌîåÎû´Ìèº Ïù¥Ï†Ñ, Ï†ïÎßê ÎãπÏã†Ïùò ÏàòÏùµÏùÑ Î∞îÍøîÏ§ÑÍπåÏöî? ÏõåÎìúÌîÑÎ†àÏä§Î°úÏùò Ïù¥Ï†ÑÏùÑ Í≥†ÎØºÌïòÎäî Î∂ÑÎì§ÏùÑ ÏúÑÌï¥ ÌòÑÏã§Ï†ÅÏù∏ Ï°∞Ïñ∏Í≥º Î∏îÎ°úÍ∑∏ ÏÑ±Í≥µÏùò Î≥∏ÏßàÏùÑ 5Îã®Í≥ÑÎ°ú ÎÇòÎàÑÏñ¥ Ïã¨ÎèÑ ÏûàÍ≤å ÏßöÏñ¥ÎìúÎ¶ΩÎãàÎã§.

 

ÏµúÍ∑º Ìã∞Ïä§ÌÜ†Î¶¨Ïùò Ïï†ÎìúÏÑºÏä§ Í¥ëÍ≥† Ï†ïÏ±Ö Î≥ÄÌôîÏôÄ Ïπ¥Ïπ¥Ïò§ Î∂ÑÏÇ¨ Ïù¥ÏäàÎ°ú Îí§Ïà≠Ïà≠ÌïòÏãúÏ£†? Ï†ÄÎèÑ ÎßàÏ∞¨Í∞ÄÏßÄÏûÖÎãàÎã§. ÎßéÏùÄ Î∂ÑÎì§Ïù¥ Ï†ïÎì† Ìã∞Ïä§ÌÜ†Î¶¨Î•º Îñ†ÎÇò ÏõåÎìúÌîÑÎ†àÏä§ Í∞ôÏùÄ ÏÉàÎ°úÏö¥ ÌîåÎû´ÌèºÏúºÎ°úÏùò Ïù¥Ï†ÑÏùÑ Ïã¨Í∞ÅÌïòÍ≤å Í≥†ÎØºÌïòÍ≥† Í≥ÑÏã† Í≤É Í∞ôÏïÑÏöî. ÌïòÏßÄÎßå ÏÉàÎ°úÏö¥ ÏãúÏûëÏóê ÎåÄÌïú ÎßâÏó∞Ìïú Í∏∞ÎåÄÍ∞êÎßåÏúºÎ°ú ÏÑ£Î∂àÎ¶¨ ÏõÄÏßÅÏù¥Í∏∞ Ï†ÑÏóê, Ïö∞Î¶¨ Ïû†Ïãú Î©àÏ∂∞ÏÑú ÎÉâÏ†ïÌïòÍ≤å ÌòÑÏã§ÏùÑ ÌïúÎ≤à ÎèåÏïÑÎ≥¥Îäî Í±¥ Ïñ¥Îñ®ÍπåÏöî?

 

1. ÌîåÎû´Ìèº Ïù¥Ï†Ñ, Í∑∏ Ï†ÑÏóê 'ÎÇò'Î•º ÏßÑÎã®ÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî

Google NotebookLM ÎèôÏòÅÏÉÅ Í∞úÏöî, Ïôú ÏïÑÏßÅÎèÑ ÏòÅÏñ¥Îßå ÏßÄÏõêÌï†ÍπåÏöî? ÌïúÍµ≠ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÎ•º ÏúÑÌïú AI STUDIO ÎßûÏ∂§Ìòï ÏßÄÏπ®ÏúºÎ°ú ÏôÑÎ≤ΩÌïú ÌïúÍµ≠Ïñ¥ ÏòÅÏÉÅ Í∞úÏöîÎ•º ÎßåÎìúÎäî ÎπÑÎ≤ïÏùÑ Îã¥ÏïòÏäµÎãàÎã§. Ïù¥Ï†ú Ïñ∏Ïñ¥Ïùò Ïû•Î≤Ω ÏóÜÏù¥ Ï∞ΩÏùòÏ†ÅÏù∏ ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏†Î•º ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Î≥¥ÏÑ∏Ïöî!

 

 ÌòπÏãú Google NotebookLMÏùò ÎèôÏòÅÏÉÅ Í∞úÏöî Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ïç®Î≥¥ÏÖ®Îã§Í∞Ä Ï†ÄÏ≤òÎüº ÏÇ¥Ïßù Ïã§ÎßùÌïú Ï†Å ÏûàÏúºÏã†Í∞ÄÏöî? Ï†ïÎßê ÎÜÄÎùºÏö¥ Í∏∞Îä•Ïù∏Îç∞, ÎßâÏÉÅ Ïç®Î≥¥Î©¥ ÏùåÏÑ± ÏöîÏïΩÏù¥ÎÇò Ïä¨ÎùºÏù¥Îìú ÎÇ¥Ïö©Ïù¥ Ï†ÑÎ∂Ä ÏòÅÎ¨∏ÏúºÎ°úÎßå ÎÇòÏôÄÏÑú 'ÌïúÍµ≠Ïñ¥ ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏†ÏóêÎäî Ïì∏Î™®ÏóÜÎÇò?' ÌïòÎäî ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÏù¥ Îì§ ÎïåÍ∞Ä ÏûàÎçîÎùºÍ≥†Ïöî. Ï†ú Ï£ºÎ≥ÄÏóêÎèÑ Ïù¥Îü∞ Í≥†ÎØºÏùÑ ÌïòÏãúÎäî Î∂ÑÎì§Ïù¥ Ï†ïÎßê ÎßéÏïòÏñ¥Ïöî. ÏïÑÎßà Ï†ÄÎßå Í∑∏Îü∞ Í±¥ ÏïÑÎãê Í±∞ÏòàÏöî.

Í∑∏Îü∞Îç∞ ÎßêÏù¥Ï£†, Ìè¨Í∏∞ÌïòÍ∏∞Ïóî Ïù¥ Í∏∞Îä•Ïù¥ ÎÑàÎ¨¥ ÏïÑÍπùÏûñÏïÑÏöî? Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Ï†úÍ∞Ä ÏßÅÏ†ë AI STUDIOÎ•º ÌôúÏö©Ìï¥ Ïù¥ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ïö∞Î¶¨ÎßêÏóê ÏôÑÎ≤ΩÌïòÍ≤å ÎßûÏ∂îÎäî Î∞©Î≤ïÏùÑ Ïó∞Íµ¨Ìï¥Î¥§Ïñ¥Ïöî. Í∏∞Ï°¥Ïùò ÌÖçÏä§Ìä∏ Í∏∞Î∞ò ÏöîÏïΩ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ ÌôïÏû•Ìï¥ÏÑú ÏòÅÏÉÅ Í∞úÏöîÎ•º ÎßåÎìúÎäî Ïù¥ ÌòÅÏã†Ï†ÅÏù∏ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ, Ïù¥Ï†ú Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÎèÑ ÌïúÍµ≠Ïñ¥ Î¨∏ÏÑúÎ°ú ÎßàÏùåÍªè ÌôúÏö©Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÎèÑÎ°ù ÏïÑÏ£º ÏâΩÍ≥† ÏπúÏ†àÌïòÍ≤å ÏïåÎ†§ÎìúÎ¶¥Í≤åÏöî. Ïù¥ Í∏ÄÎßå ÏùΩÏúºÎ©¥ Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏùò ÏûëÏóÖ Ìö®Ïú®Ïù¥ Ï†ïÎßê ÎπÑÏïΩÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÏÉÅÏäπÌï† Í±∞ÎùºÍ≥† Ïû•Îã¥Ìï©ÎãàÎã§!

 

1. Google NotebookLMÏùò ÎÜÄÎùºÏö¥ Í∏∞Îä•Îì§ ‚ú®

Google NotebookLMÏùÄ Google LabsÏóêÏÑú Í∞úÎ∞úÌïú AI Í∏∞Î∞òÏùò ÌòÅÏã†Ï†ÅÏù∏ ÎèÑÍµ¨ÏûÖÎãàÎã§. Ïù¥ ÎèÑÍµ¨Îäî Îã®ÏàúÌûà Í≤ÄÏÉâ Í≤∞Í≥ºÎ•º Ï∞æÏïÑÏ£ºÎäî Í≤ÉÏùÑ ÎÑòÏñ¥, ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÍ∞Ä ÏóÖÎ°úÎìúÌïú Î¨∏ÏÑúÎ•º Í∏∞Î∞òÏúºÎ°ú ÏÉÅÌò∏ÏûëÏö©ÌïòÎ©∞ Ï†ïÎ≥¥Î•º Î∂ÑÏÑùÌïòÍ≥† Ï†ïÎ¶¨ÌïòÎäî Îç∞ ÌäπÌôîÎêòÏñ¥ ÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî. GoogleÏùò Í∞ïÎ†•Ìïú AI Î™®Îç∏Ïù∏ GeminiÎ•º ÌôúÏö©Ìï¥ Î≥µÏû°Ìïú ÏûêÎ£åÎ•º Î™ÖÌôïÌïòÍ≤å Î∞îÍøîÏ£ºÍ≥†, Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏùò Ïó∞Íµ¨ÏôÄ ÌïôÏäµ Í≥ºÏ†ïÏùÑ Ìö®Ïú®Ï†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï£ºÎäî Ïò®ÎùºÏù∏ ÏÑúÎπÑÏä§ÎùºÍ≥† Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.

NotebookLMÏùÄ Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏùò ÏûëÏóÖ Ìö®Ïú®ÏùÑ Í∑πÎåÄÌôîÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎèÑÎ°ù Îã§ÏñëÌïú Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ï†úÍ≥µÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Ïñ¥Îñ§ Í∏∞Îä•Îì§Ïù¥ ÏûàÎäîÏßÄ ÏûêÏÑ∏Ìûà ÏïåÏïÑÎ≥ºÍπåÏöî?

  • ÏÜåÏä§ ÏóÖÎ°úÎìú Î∞è Î∂ÑÏÑù: PDF, ÏõπÏÇ¨Ïù¥Ìä∏, Google Î¨∏ÏÑú, Ïä¨ÎùºÏù¥Îìú Îì± Îã§ÏñëÌïú ÌòïÏãùÏùò ÏÜåÏä§Î•º Ïò¨Î¶¥ Ïàò ÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî. ÎÜÄÎûçÍ≤åÎèÑ ÏµúÎåÄ 50Í∞úÏùò ÏÜåÏä§, Ï¥ù 2,500Îßå Îã®Ïñ¥ÍπåÏßÄ Ìïú Î≤àÏóê Ï≤òÎ¶¨Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÎã§Í≥† ÌïòÎãà, Î∞©ÎåÄÌïú ÏñëÏùò ÏûêÎ£åÎèÑ Í±±Ï†ï ÏóÜÍ≤†Ï£†!
  • ÏöîÏïΩ Î∞è ÏÑ§Î™Ö ÏÉùÏÑ±: ÏóÖÎ°úÎìúÎêú ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏†Î•º Î∞îÌÉïÏúºÎ°ú ÌïµÏã¨ ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÑ ÏöîÏïΩÌïòÍ≥†, ÏÉÅÏÑ∏Ìïú ÏÑ§Î™ÖÏùÑ ÏÉùÏÑ±Ìï¥ Ï§çÎãàÎã§. ÌäπÌûà, ÎãµÎ≥ÄÏùò Ï∂úÏ≤òÎ•º ÏõêÎ≥∏ ÏÜåÏä§Ïóê ÎåÄÌïú Ïù∏Ïö©ÏúºÎ°ú Ï†úÍ≥µÌï¥ Ï§òÏÑú Ï†ïÎ≥¥Ïùò Ïã†Î¢∞ÏÑ±ÏùÑ ÌôïÏã§ÌïòÍ≤å Î≥¥Ïû•Ìï©ÎãàÎã§.
  • Ïò§ÎîîÏò§ Ïò§Î≤ÑÎ∑∞: 2024ÎÖÑ 9ÏõîÏóê Ï∂úÏãúÎêòÏñ¥ ÌÅ∞ Ï£ºÎ™©ÏùÑ Î∞õÏïòÎçò Í∏∞Îä•Ïù¥ÏóêÏöî. Î¨∏ÏÑúÎ•º ÎåÄÌôîÌòï ÌåüÏ∫êÏä§Ìä∏ ÌòïÏãùÏúºÎ°ú ÏöîÏïΩÌï¥ Ï£ºÍ∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê, Îã®ÏàúÌûà ÏùΩÎäî Í≤ÉÎ≥¥Îã§ Ìõ®Ïî¨ Ïû¨ÎØ∏ÏûàÍ≥† ÏâΩÍ≤å ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÑ ÌååÏïÖÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎãµÎãàÎã§.
  • ÌòïÏãù Î≥ÄÌôò: ÏÜåÏä§ Î¨∏ÏÑúÎ•º ÌïôÏäµ Í∞ÄÏù¥Îìú, Î∏åÎ¶¨Ìïë Î¨∏ÏÑú, ÎßàÏù∏ÎìúÎßµ Îì± Îã§ÏñëÌïú ÌòïÏãùÏúºÎ°ú Î≥ÄÌôòÌï¥Ï§òÏöî. Î≥µÏû°Ìïú ÏûêÎ£åÎ•º ÎÇ¥Í∞Ä ÏõêÌïòÎäî ÌòïÌÉúÎ°ú Ï¶âÏãú Î∞îÍøîÏ£ºÎãà, ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏† Í∏∞ÌöçÏûêÎÇò ÌïôÏÉùÎì§ÏóêÍ≤å Ï†ïÎßê Ïú†Ïö©ÌïòÍ≤†Ï£†.
  • Ï±ÑÌåÖ Î∞è ÏßàÎ¨∏: ÎßàÏπò ÏπúÍµ¨ÏôÄ ÎåÄÌôîÌïòÎìØ ÎÖ∏Ìä∏Î∂ÅÍ≥º Ï±ÑÌåÖÌïòÎ©∞ Í∂ÅÍ∏àÌïú Ï†êÏùÑ Î¨ºÏñ¥Î≥º Ïàò ÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî. Î≥µÏû°Ìïú Ï∂îÎ°†Ïù¥ ÌïÑÏöîÌïú ÏßàÎ¨∏ÏóêÎèÑ Ï†ïÌôïÌïòÍ≥† Ïã†Î¢∞ÏÑ± ÏûàÎäî ÎãµÎ≥ÄÏùÑ ÏñªÏùÑ Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.

Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å NotebookLMÏùÄ ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Îã§Îì¨Í≥† Ï†ïÎ¶¨ÌïòÎäî Îç∞ ÌäπÌôîÎêú Í∞ïÎ†•Ìïú ÎèÑÍµ¨ÎûçÎãàÎã§. Îçî ÎÜíÏùÄ ÌïúÎèÑÏôÄ ÌîÑÎ¶¨ÎØ∏ÏóÑ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ï†úÍ≥µÌïòÎäî Í∏∞ÏóÖÏö© Î≤ÑÏ†Ñ(NotebookLM Plus)ÎèÑ ÏûàÏúºÎãà Ï∞∏Í≥†ÌïòÏãúÎ©¥ Ï¢ãÏùÑ Í≤É Í∞ôÏïÑÏöî.

ÏïåÏïÑÎëêÏÑ∏Ïöî!
NotebookLMÏùÄ ÏóÖÎ°úÎìúÎêú ÏÜåÏä§ ÏûêÎ£åÏóê Í∑ºÍ±∞Ìï¥ ÎãµÎ≥ÄÏùÑ ÏÉùÏÑ±ÌïòÍ∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê, ÏûòÎ™ªÎêú Ï†ïÎ≥¥ÎÇò 'ÌôòÍ∞Å' ÌòÑÏÉÅ(Hallucination)Ïù¥ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇ† ÌôïÎ•†Ïù¥ ÌòÑÏ†ÄÌûà ÎÇÆÏïÑÏöî. Ïù¥ Ï†êÏù¥ NotebookLMÏùò Í∞ÄÏû• ÌÅ∞ Ïû•Ï†ê Ï§ë ÌïòÎÇòÎûçÎãàÎã§.

 

2. ÎèôÏòÅÏÉÅ Í∞úÏöî Í∏∞Îä•, ÌïúÍµ≠Ïñ¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÏùò ÎèÑÏ†ÑÍ≥ºÏ†ú ‚ö†Ô∏è

 ÏµúÍ∑º NotebookLMÏùò ÎèôÏòÅÏÉÅ Í∞úÏöî Í∏∞Îä•Ïù¥ Ï≤òÏùå Í≥µÍ∞úÎêòÏóàÏùÑ Îïå, Ï†ÄÎèÑ Ï†ïÎßê Í∏∞ÎåÄÍ∞Ä Ïª∏Ïñ¥Ïöî. Í∑∏Îü∞Îç∞ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï¥Î≥¥Îãà Ìïú Í∞ÄÏßÄ ÌÅ∞ Î≤ΩÏóê Î∂ÄÎî™ÌûàÎçîÎùºÍ≥†Ïöî. Î∞îÎ°ú Ïù¥ Í∏∞Îä•Ïù¥ Í≥µÏãùÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÏòÅÎ¨∏ ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏†ÏóêÎßå ÏµúÏ†ÅÌôîÎêòÏñ¥ ÏûàÎã§Îäî Ï†êÏù¥ÏóàÏ£†. 

 

 ÏùåÏÑ±Í≥º Ïä¨ÎùºÏù¥ÎìúÏóê ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇòÎäî ÌÖçÏä§Ìä∏Îäî ÏòÅÎ¨∏ÏúºÎ°úÎßå ÏÉùÏÑ±ÎêòÏñ¥, Ïö∞Î¶¨Îßê ÏΩòÌÖêÏ∏†Î•º ÎßåÎìúÎäî ÌÅ¨Î¶¨ÏóêÏù¥ÌÑ∞ÎÇò Í∏∞ÌöçÏûê ÏûÖÏû•ÏóêÏÑúÎäî Ï†ïÎßê ÎãµÎãµÌï† ÏàòÎ∞ñÏóê ÏóÜÏ£†. Ïù¥ Ï¢ãÏùÄ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Í∑∏Î¶ºÏùò Îñ°Ï≤òÎüº Î∞îÎùºÎßå Î¥êÏïº ÌïòÎäî ÏÉÅÌô©Ïù¥ÏóàÎãµÎãàÎã§.

AIÍ∞Ä ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï§Ä Í≤∞Í≥ºÎ¨ºÏù¥ÎùºÍ≥† Ìï¥ÏÑú ÎßπÏã†ÌïòÎ©¥ Ïïà Îê©ÎãàÎã§. ÌäπÌûà Î≥µÏû°ÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò Ï†ÑÎ¨∏Ï†ÅÏù∏ ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÑ Îã§Î£∞ ÎïåÎäî AIÍ∞Ä ÎÜìÏπú Îß•ÎùΩÏù¥ÎÇò ÏÑ∏Î∂Ä ÏÇ¨Ìï≠Ïù¥ ÏóÜÎäîÏßÄ Î∞òÎìúÏãú ÏµúÏ¢Ö ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÎäî Í≥ºÏ†ïÏù¥ ÌïÑÏöîÌï¥Ïöî.

 

3. AI STUDIOÎ•º ÌôúÏö©Ìïú ÌïúÍµ≠Ïñ¥ ÏµúÏ†ÅÌôî Í∞ÄÏù¥ÎìúÏùò ÌïµÏã¨ ÏõêÎ¶¨

Í∑∏Îüº Ïù¥Ï†úÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ AI STUDIOÏùò ÎßûÏ∂§ ÏÑ§Ï†ïÏùÑ ÌôúÏö©Ìï¥ Google NotebookLMÏùò ÎèôÏòÅÏÉÅ Í∞úÏöî Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ïö∞Î¶¨ÎßêÏóê ÎßûÍ≤å 'Í∏∏Îì§Ïù¥Îäî' Î∞©Î≤ïÏùÑ ÏïåÎ†§ÎìúÎ¶¥Í≤åÏöî. posts.creator: Ïñ¥Îñ§Ïò§ÌõÑÏùò ÌîÑÎ¶¨Ïõ®Ïñ¥ Ïù¥ÏïºÍ∏∞
posts.title: ÎÖ∏ÏΩîÎìúÏùò ÎØ∏Îûò: Íµ¨Í∏Ä Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçî Ïã§Ï†Ñ Í∞ÄÏù¥Îìú (Ìï†Ïùº Ïï±, Í≤åÏûÑ, Ï±óÎ¥á ÎßåÎì§Í∏∞)
posts.author: Ïñ¥Îñ§Ïò§ÌõÑÏùò ÌîÑÎ¶¨Ïõ®Ïñ¥ Ïù¥ÏïºÍ∏∞
posts.content:
ÏΩîÎî© 1ÎèÑ Î™∞ÎùºÎèÑ Ïï± Í∞úÎ∞ú? Íµ¨Í∏Ä Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçî ÏÇ¨Ïö©Î≤ï Ï¥ùÏ†ïÎ¶¨ ÏΩîÎî© Í≤ΩÌóòÏù¥ Ï†ÑÌòÄ ÏóÜÎäî Î∂ÑÎì§ÎèÑ Ï±ÑÌåÖÌïòÎìØ ÎßêÎßå ÌïòÎ©¥ Ïã§Ï†úÎ°ú ÎèôÏûëÌïòÎäî Ïï±, Ïã¨ÏßÄÏñ¥ Í≤åÏûÑÍπåÏßÄ ÎßåÎì§ Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Íµ¨Í∏ÄÏùò Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçîÎ°ú ÎÇòÎßåÏùò Ïã§Ïö©Ï†ÅÏù∏ Î¨¥Î£å Ïï±ÏùÑ ÎßåÎìúÎäî Î∞©Î≤ïÏùÑ ÏßÄÍ∏à Î∞îÎ°ú ÌôïÏù∏Ìï¥ Î≥¥ÏÑ∏Ïöî.

 

ÏΩîÎî© Í≤ΩÌóòÏù¥ 1ÎèÑ ÏóÜÎäî Ï¥àÎ≥¥Î∂ÑÎì§ÎèÑ ÎßàÏπò ÏπúÍµ¨ÏôÄ Ï±ÑÌåÖÌïòÎìØÏù¥ ÎßêÎßå ÌïòÎ©¥ Ïã§Ï†úÎ°ú ÎèôÏûëÌïòÎäî Ïï±ÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§ Ïàò ÏûàÎã§Î©¥ Ïñ¥Îñ®ÍπåÏöî? Í∑∏Í≤ÉÎèÑ Îã®ÏàúÌïú Ïï±Ïù¥ ÏïÑÎãàÎùº ÏßÑÏßú Í≤åÏûÑÍπåÏßÄ ÎßêÏù¥ÏóêÏöî. Ïã¨ÏßÄÏñ¥ Ïù¥ Î™®Îì† Í≥ºÏ†ïÏù¥ ÏôÑÏ†Ñ Î¨¥Î£åÎùºÎ©¥Ïöî? Ïò§ÎäòÏùÄ Íµ¨Í∏ÄÏùò Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçî(Gemini App Builder)Î•º ÌôúÏö©Ìï¥ÏÑú, Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÎèÑ ÏûêÏã†ÎßåÏùò Ïã§Ïö©Ï†ÅÏù∏ Ïï±ÏùÑ ÎßåÎìúÎäî Î∞©Î≤ïÏùÑ AÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ ZÍπåÏßÄ ÏïåÎ†§ÎìúÎ¶¥Í≤åÏöî.

Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçî, ÎåÄÏ≤¥ Î≠îÍ∞ÄÏöî?

Î®ºÏ†Ä Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçîÍ∞Ä Î¨¥ÏóáÏù∏ÏßÄ Í∞ÑÎã®Ìûà ÏÜåÍ∞úÌï¥ ÎìúÎ¶¥Í≤åÏöî. Google AI StudioÏóêÏÑú Ï†úÍ≥µÌïòÎäî ÏÉùÏÑ±Ìòï AI Í∏∞Î∞òÏùò Ïï± Í∞úÎ∞ú ÎèÑÍµ¨Ïù∏Îç∞Ïöî. ÏâΩÍ≤å ÎßêÌï¥, Ïö∞Î¶¨Í∞Ä "Ïù¥Îü∞ Ïï± ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï§ò!" ÌïòÍ≥† ÏûêÏó∞Ïñ¥Î°ú ÏÑ§Î™ÖÌïòÎ©¥, AIÍ∞Ä Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞ Íµ¨Ï°∞ ÏÑ§Í≥ÑÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ ÌôîÎ©¥ ÎîîÏûêÏù∏, Í∏∞Îä• ÏΩîÎî©ÍπåÏßÄ ÏïåÏïÑÏÑú Îã§ Ìï¥Ï£ºÎäî ÌòÅÏã†Ï†ÅÏù∏ ÎèÑÍµ¨ÏòàÏöî.

ÏÜîÏßÅÌûà Ïï± ÌïòÎÇò ÎßåÎì§Î†§Î©¥ React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS Í∞ôÏùÄ Î≥µÏû°Ìïú Í∏∞Ïà†Îì§ÏùÑ Î∞∞ÏõåÏïº Ìï¥ÏÑú ÏãúÏûëÎèÑ Ï†ÑÏóê Ìè¨Í∏∞ÌïòÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞Í∞Ä ÎßéÏûñÏïÑÏöî. ÌïòÏßÄÎßå Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçîÎäî Ïù¥ Î™®Îì† ÏµúÏã† Í∏∞Ïà†ÏùÑ ÎÇ¥Î∂ÄÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎ©¥ÏÑúÎèÑ, ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÎäî Ï†ÑÌòÄ Ïïå ÌïÑÏöîÍ∞Ä ÏóÜÎã§Îäî Í≤å Í∞ÄÏû• ÎÜÄÎùºÏö¥ Ï†êÏù¥ÏóêÏöî. ÎßàÏπò ÏûêÎèôÏ∞® ÏóîÏßÑÏùò ÏõêÎ¶¨Î•º Î™∞ÎùºÎèÑ Ïö¥Ï†ÑÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎäî Í≤ÉÏ≤òÎüºÏöî!

AIÍ∞Ä ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎäî ÏµúÏã† Í∏∞Ïà† ÏÇ¥Ïßù ÏóøÎ≥¥Í∏∞

  • React (Î¶¨Ïï°Ìä∏): ÌôîÎ©¥ÏùÑ 'Î†àÍ≥† Î∏îÎ°ù(Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏)'Ï≤òÎüº Ïó¨Îü¨ Í∞úÏùò ÎèÖÎ¶ΩÏ†ÅÏù∏ Î∂ÄÌíàÏúºÎ°ú ÎÇòÎàÑÏñ¥ Ï°∞Î¶ΩÌïòÎäî Î∞©ÏãùÏù¥ÏóêÏöî. Ìï† Ïùº Î™©Î°ù, Ìï† Ïùº Ï∂îÍ∞Ä Î≤ÑÌäº Îì±Ïù¥ Í∞ÅÍ∞ÅÏùò Î∏îÎ°ùÏ≤òÎüº ÎèÖÎ¶ΩÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÏûëÎèôÌï¥ÏÑú Ìïú Í≥≥Ïóê Ïò§Î•òÍ∞Ä ÏÉùÍ≤®ÎèÑ Îã§Î•∏ Í≥≥Ïóê ÏòÅÌñ•ÏùÑ Ï£ºÏßÄ ÏïäÏ£†.
  • TypeScript (ÌÉÄÏûÖÏä§ÌÅ¨Î¶ΩÌä∏): ÏΩîÎìúÏùò 'ÎßûÏ∂§Î≤ï Í≤ÄÏÇ¨Í∏∞' Í∞ôÏùÄ Ïó≠Ìï†ÏùÑ Ìï¥Ïöî. Ïà´ÏûêÎßå ÏûÖÎ†•Ìï¥Ïïº ÌïòÎäî Í≥≥Ïóê Î¨∏ÏûêÎ•º ÎÑ£ÏúºÎ©¥ "Ïù¥Í±∞ ÌÉÄÏûÖÏù¥ Ïïà ÎßûÏïÑÏöî!" ÌïòÍ≥† ÎØ∏Î¶¨ ÏïåÎ†§Ï§òÏÑú Î≤ÑÍ∑∏Î•º Ï§ÑÏó¨Ï§ÄÎãµÎãàÎã§.
  • Tailwind CSS (ÌÖåÏùºÏúàÎìú CSS): ÎØ∏Î¶¨ ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥ÏßÑ ÎîîÏûêÏù∏ Ï°∞Í∞ÅÎì§ÏùÑ Ï°∞Ìï©Ìï¥ÏÑú Îπ†Î•¥Í≥† ÏÑ∏Î†®ÎêòÍ≤å Ïï±ÏùÑ Íæ∏Î©∞Ï£ºÎäî ÎèÑÍµ¨ÏòàÏöî. ÎçïÎ∂ÑÏóê ÎîîÏûêÏù∏ Í∞êÍ∞ÅÏù¥ ÏóÜÏñ¥ÎèÑ ÍπîÎÅîÌïú Ïï±ÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§ Ïàò ÏûàÏñ¥Ïöî.

Ïù¥Îü∞ Î≥µÏû°Ìïú Í∏∞Ïà†Îì§ÏùÑ Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥Í∞Ä ÏïåÏïÑÏÑú Ï≤òÎ¶¨Ìï¥Ï£ºÎãà, Ïö∞Î¶¨Îäî ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Îßå ÏûàÏúºÎ©¥ Ìï† Ïùº Í¥ÄÎ¶¨ ÎèÑÍµ¨, Ïû¨ÎØ∏ÏûàÎäî Í≤åÏûÑ, AI Ï±óÎ¥á Îì± ÏÉÅÏÉÅÌïòÎäî Î™®Îì† Í≤ÉÏùÑ Î™á Î∂Ñ ÎßåÏóê ÌòÑÏã§Î°ú ÎßåÎì§ Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§. Ï†ïÎßê ÎåÄÎã®ÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÎÇòÏöî?

Ïï± ÎπåÎçî ÏãúÏûëÌïòÍ∏∞: ÌôîÎ©¥ Íµ¨ÏÑ± Î∞è Í∏∞Î≥∏ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Î≤ï

Ïûê, Í∑∏Îüº Ìï®Íªò Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçîÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï¥Î≥ºÍπåÏöî? Î®ºÏ†Ä Ïù∏ÌÑ∞ÎÑ∑ Î∏åÎùºÏö∞Ï†ÄÏóêÏÑú Google AI Studio ÌôàÌéòÏù¥ÏßÄÎ°ú Ï†ëÏÜçÌï¥Ï£ºÏÑ∏Ïöî. Íµ¨Í∏Ä Í≥ÑÏ†ï Î°úÍ∑∏Ïù∏ÏùÄ ÌïÑÏàòÏûÖÎãàÎã§!

Ïù¥Í≤ÉÏúºÎ°ú AI Ïä§ÌäúÎîîÏò§Ïùò Ï†úÎØ∏ÎÇòÏù¥ Ïï± ÎπåÎçîÎ•º ÌôúÏö©Ìïú ÎÖ∏ÏΩîÎìú Ïï± Í∞úÎ∞ú Í∞ïÏùòÎ•º ÎßàÏπòÍ≤†ÏäµÎãàÎã§. Ïò§Îäò Î∞∞Ïö¥ ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏúºÎ°ú Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÎèÑ ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Îßå ÏûàÎã§Î©¥ ÎàÑÍµ¨ÎÇò Ïã§Ïö©Ï†ÅÏù∏ Ïï±ÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§ Ïàò ÏûàÎäî ÏãúÎåÄÍ∞Ä Ïó¥Î†∏Îã§Îäî Í≤ÉÏùÑ ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÏÖ®ÏùÑ Í±∞ÏòàÏöî. Ïò§Îäò Í∞ïÏùòÍ∞Ä ÎèÑÏõÄÏù¥ ÎêòÏÖ®Îã§Î©¥ Íµ¨ÎèÖÍ≥º Ï¢ãÏïÑÏöî Íº≠ ÎàåÎü¨Ï£ºÏãúÍ≥†, Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏù¥ ÎßåÎìúÏã† Î©ãÏßÑ Ïï±ÎèÑ ÎåìÍ∏ÄÎ°ú ÏûêÎûëÌï¥Ï£ºÏÑ∏Ïöî! Í∞êÏÇ¨Ìï©ÎãàÎã§!

posts.title: ÎßâÎßâÌïú ÏΩîÎî©, Ïù¥Ï†ú Í∑∏Îßå! AI Í∞Ä ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï£ºÎäî 10Í∞ÄÏßÄ Ï¥àÍ∏∞ Í∞úÎ∞ú ÏßàÎ¨∏

posts.content:
ÏΩîÎî© ÏôïÏ¥àÎ≥¥Î•º ÏúÑÌïú Gemini Ï†¨ ÏßÄÏπ® 10Í∞ÄÏßÄ ÏßàÎ¨∏ ÏΩîÎî©ÏùÑ Ï≤òÏùå ÏãúÏûëÌïòÎäî Î∂ÑÎì§ÏùÑ ÏúÑÌï¥ ÎßâÏó∞Ìïú ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Íµ¨Ï≤¥ÌôîÌïòÍ≥†, Í∞úÎ∞ú Ï¥àÍ∏∞ Îã®Í≥ÑÏóê ÌïÑÏöîÌïú ÏßÄÏπ®ÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï£ºÎäî Gemini Ï†¨Ïùò ÏûëÎèô ÏõêÎ¶¨ÏôÄ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Î≤ïÏùÑ ÏÜåÍ∞úÌï©ÎãàÎã§.

 

ÏΩîÎî©ÏùÑ Î∞∞Ïö∞Í≥† Ïã∂Îã§Îäî ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÏóê Í∞ÄÏä¥ ÏÑ§Î†àÎ©∞ ÏãúÏûëÌñàÎäîÎç∞, ÎßâÏÉÅ Î¨¥ÏóáÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ Ìï¥Ïïº Ìï†ÏßÄ ÎßâÎßâÌñàÎçò Í≤ΩÌóò, Îã§Îì§ Ìïú Î≤àÏØ§ ÏûàÏúºÏãúÏ£†? Ï†ÄÎèÑ Í∑∏Îû¨Ïñ¥Ïöî. Î®∏Î¶øÏÜçÏóê Î≤àÎú©Ïù¥Îäî ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Îäî ÏûàÎäîÎç∞ Ïù¥Í±∏ Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å ÏΩîÎìúÎ°ú ÏòÆÍ≤®Ïïº Ìï†ÏßÄ ÎèÑÏ†ÄÌûà Í∞êÏù¥ Ïïà Ïû°ÌûàÎçîÎùºÍ≥†Ïöî. Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Ï†úÍ∞Ä ÏΩîÎî© ÏôïÏ¥àÎ≥¥ ÏãúÏ†àÏóê Í∞ÄÏû• ÌïÑÏöîÌñàÎçò Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Îã¥ÏùÄ Gemini Ï†¨ÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Î¥§Ïñ¥Ïöî. Ïù¥ Ï†¨ÏùÄ ÎßàÏπò ÏπúÏ†àÌïú ÏΩîÎî© Î©òÌÜ†Ï≤òÎüº, Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏùò ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ï†ÅÏù∏ Í∞úÎ∞ú ÏßÄÏãúÏÇ¨Ìï≠ÏúºÎ°ú Î∞îÍøîÏ£ºÎäî Ïó≠Ìï†ÏùÑ ÌïúÎãµÎãàÎã§. Ïù¥ Í∏ÄÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ Ï†¨Ïùò ÏûëÎèô ÏõêÎ¶¨ÏôÄ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Î≤ïÏùÑ ÏÉÅÏÑ∏Ìûà ÏïåÎ†§ÎìúÎ¶¥Í≤åÏöî!

 

ÏΩîÎî© ÏôïÏ¥àÎ≥¥ Ï†¨, Ïñ¥Îñ§ Ï†¨Ïù∏Í∞ÄÏöî?

Ïù¥ Ï†¨Ïùò Ïù¥Î¶ÑÏùÄ 'Î∞îÏù¥Î∏åÏΩîÎî© Ïï± ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥ Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ìôî Î∞è ÎπåÎçî ÏöîÏ≤≠ ÏÉùÏÑ± Ï†¨'Ïù¥ÏóêÏöî. Ïù¥Î¶ÑÏù¥ Ï¢Ä Í∏∏Ï£†? ÏâΩÍ≤å ÎßêÌï¥, Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏùò Î®∏Î¶øÏÜçÏóê ÏûàÎäî ÎßâÏó∞Ìïú Ïï± ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Ïã§Ï†ú Í∞úÎ∞úÏûêÍ∞Ä Î∞îÎ°ú ÏûëÏóÖÏóê Ï∞©ÏàòÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏùÑ ÎßåÌÅº Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ï†ÅÏù∏ ÏßÄÏãúÏÇ¨Ìï≠ÏúºÎ°ú Ï†ïÎ¶¨Ìï¥Ï£ºÎäî Ï†¨Ïù¥ÎûçÎãàÎã§. Ïù¥ Ï†¨ÏùÄ Îëê Í∞ÄÏßÄ Îã®Í≥ÑÎ°ú ÏûëÎèôÌï¥Ïöî.

  • 1. ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥ Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ìôî ÎåÄÌôî: ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÍ∞Ä "ÏãúÏûë"Ïù¥ÎùºÍ≥† ÏûÖÎ†•ÌïòÎ©¥, Ïï±Ïùò Ïª®ÏÖâ, ÌïµÏã¨ Í∏∞Îä•, Î∂ÑÏúÑÍ∏∞ Îì±ÏùÑ ÌååÏïÖÌïòÎäî ÏßàÎ¨∏ÏùÑ ÎçòÏ†∏Ïöî.
  • 2. ÎπåÎçî ÏöîÏ≤≠ ÏÉùÏÑ±: ÎåÄÌôîÍ∞Ä Ï∂©Î∂ÑÌûà ÏßÑÌñâÎêòÎ©¥, ÎåÄÌôî ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÑ Î∞îÌÉïÏúºÎ°ú Í∞úÎ∞úÏóê ÌïÑÏöîÌïú Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ï†ÅÏù∏ ÏßÄÏãúÏÇ¨Ìï≠ 10Í∞úÎ•º ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï§çÎãàÎã§.

Ïù¥ Ï†¨Ïùò Î™©ÌëúÎäî ÏπúÏ†àÌïòÍ≥† ÌÜµÏ∞∞Î†• ÏûàÎäî AI Ïñ¥ÏãúÏä§ÌÑ¥Ìä∏ Ïó≠Ìï†ÏùÑ ÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏù¥ÏóêÏöî. ÏΩîÎî©ÏùÑ Ï≤òÏùå Ï†ëÌïòÎäî Î∂ÑÎì§ÎèÑ Í≤ÅÎ®πÏßÄ ÏïäÍ≥†, ÎßàÏπò Î©òÌÜ†ÏôÄ ÎåÄÌôîÌïòÎìØ Ìé∏ÏïàÌïòÍ≤å ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Î∞úÏ†ÑÏãúÌÇ¨ Ïàò ÏûàÎèÑÎ°ù ÎèïÎäî Í±∞Ï£†.

ÏïåÏïÑÎëêÏÑ∏Ïöî!
Ïù¥ Ï†¨ÏùÄ "Î∞îÏù¥Î∏åÏΩîÎî©(Vibecoding)" Ïï± ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏ ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Íµ¨Ï≤¥ÌôîÌïòÎèÑÎ°ù ÎèïÎäî Ïó≠Ìï†ÏùÑ Ìï©ÎãàÎã§. ÎßâÏó∞Ìïú ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Î™ÖÌôïÌïòÍ≤å ÎßåÎì§Í≥†, Ïã§Ï†ú AI ÏΩîÎî© ÎèÑÍµ¨Í∞Ä ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÎäî Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ï†ÅÏù∏ Í∞úÎ∞ú ÏßÄÏãúÏÇ¨Ìï≠ÏúºÎ°ú Î≥ÄÌôòÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏù¥ ÌïµÏã¨ Î™©ÌëúÏûÖÎãàÎã§.

 

Ï†¨ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Î≤ï: 3Îã®Í≥Ñ ÏßàÎ¨∏ÏúºÎ°ú ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥ Íµ¨Ï≤¥ÌôîÌïòÍ∏∞

ÏÇ¨Ïö©Î≤ïÏùÄ Ï†ïÎßê Í∞ÑÎã®Ìï¥Ïöî! "ÏãúÏûë"Ïù¥ÎùºÍ≥† ÏûÖÎ†•ÌïòÎäî ÏàúÍ∞Ñ Ï†¨Í≥ºÏùò ÎåÄÌôîÍ∞Ä ÏãúÏûëÎê©ÎãàÎã§. Ï†¨ÏùÄ Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏùò ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Ïù¥ÎÅåÏñ¥ÎÇ¥Í∏∞ ÏúÑÌï¥ Ï¥ù 3Îã®Í≥ÑÏùò ÏßàÎ¨∏ÏùÑ ÎçòÏ†∏Ïöî.

ÏΩîÎî©ÏùÑ Ï≤òÏùå Ï†ëÌïòÎäî Î∂ÑÎì§Ïù¥ Í∞ÄÏû• Ïñ¥Î†§ÏõåÌïòÎäî Î∂ÄÎ∂ÑÏù¥ Î∞îÎ°ú 'Î¨¥ÏóáÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§ÏßÄ'ÏôÄ 'Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å ÏãúÏûëÌï†ÏßÄ'Î•º Íµ¨Ï≤¥ÌôîÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏù∏Îç∞, Ïù¥ Ï†¨ÏùÄ Í∑∏ ÎßâÎßâÌï®ÏùÑ Ìï¥ÏÜåÌï¥Ï£ºÎäî Ïó≠Ìï†ÏùÑ Ìï©ÎãàÎã§.

  1. 1. Ïï±Ïùò Ï†ïÏ≤¥ÏÑ± ÏßàÎ¨∏: "Ïñ¥Îñ§ Ï¢ÖÎ•òÏùò Ïï±ÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§Í≥† Ïã∂ÏúºÏã†Í∞ÄÏöî?"ÎùºÎäî ÏßàÎ¨∏ÏúºÎ°ú ÏãúÏûëÌï¥ ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Ïùò Ïú§Í≥ΩÏùÑ Ïû°ÏäµÎãàÎã§. ÏòàÏãúÎ•º ÌÜµÌï¥ ÏòÅÍ∞êÏùÑ Ï£ºÍ∏∞ÎèÑ Ìï©ÎãàÎã§.
  2. 2. ÌïµÏã¨ Í∏∞Îä• ÏßàÎ¨∏: "Í∑∏ Ïï±Ïùò Í∞ÄÏû• ÌïµÏã¨Ï†ÅÏù∏ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÄ Î¨¥ÏóáÏùºÍπåÏöî?"ÎùºÎäî ÏßàÎ¨∏ÏúºÎ°ú Ïï±Ïùò ÌïÑÏàòÏ†ÅÏù∏ Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ Ï†ïÏùòÌï©ÎãàÎã§.
  3. 3. Ïï±Ïùò 'Î∞îÏù¥Î∏å' ÏßàÎ¨∏: "Ïï±Ïùò Ï†ÑÎ∞òÏ†ÅÏù∏ Î∂ÑÏúÑÍ∏∞ÎÇò 'Î∞îÏù¥Î∏å'Îäî Ïñ¥Îï†ÏúºÎ©¥ Ï¢ãÍ≤†ÎÇòÏöî?"ÎùºÎäî ÏßàÎ¨∏ÏúºÎ°ú ÎîîÏûêÏù∏Í≥º ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ïûê Í≤ΩÌóòÏóê ÎåÄÌïú Í∞êÍ∞ÅÏ†ÅÏù∏ Î∂ÄÎ∂ÑÏùÑ Íµ¨Ï≤¥ÌôîÌï©ÎãàÎã§.

Ïù¥ 3Îã®Í≥ÑÏùò ÎåÄÌôîÍ∞Ä ÎÅùÎÇòÎ©¥, Ï†¨ÏùÄ ÎåÄÌôî ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÑ Ï¢ÖÌï©Ìï¥ÏÑú Í∞úÎ∞úÏóê ÌïÑÏöîÌïú 10Í∞ÄÏßÄ Ï¥àÍ∏∞ ÏöîÏ≤≠ÏùÑ ÏÉùÏÑ±Ìï†ÏßÄ Î¨ºÏñ¥Î¥ÖÎãàÎã§. Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏù¥ "ÎÑ§"ÎùºÍ≥† ÎåÄÎãµÌïòÎ©¥ ÎìúÎîîÏñ¥ ÏΩîÎî©Ïùò Ï≤´Í±∏ÏùåÏùÑ ÎóÑ Ïàò ÏûàÎäî Í≤∞Í≥ºÎ¨ºÏù¥ ÌÉÑÏÉùÌïòÎäî Í±∞Ï£†!

‚ö†Ô∏è Ï£ºÏùòÌïòÏÑ∏Ïöî!
Ïù¥ Ï†¨ÏùÄ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÏùò ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Î∞îÌÉïÏúºÎ°ú ÏΩîÎìúÎ•º ÏÉùÏÑ±ÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏù¥ ÏïÑÎãàÎùº, ÏΩîÎî©ÏùÑ ÏãúÏûëÌïòÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌïú Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ï†ÅÏù∏ ÏßÄÏãúÏÇ¨Ìï≠ÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï£ºÎäî ÎèÑÍµ¨ÏûÖÎãàÎã§. Ïù¥ ÏöîÏ≤≠ÏùÑ Í∏∞Î∞òÏúºÎ°ú Í∞úÎ∞úÏùÑ ÏãúÏûëÌïòÎ©¥ Îê©ÎãàÎã§.

 

Ï†¨ ÏßÄÏπ®Ïùò ÏûëÎèô ÏõêÎ¶¨ÏôÄ ÌäπÏßï ‍ ‍

Ïù¥ Ï†¨ÏùÄ GeminiÏùò Í∞ïÎ†•Ìïú ÎåÄÌôîÌòï AI Í∏∞Îä•ÏùÑ ÌôúÏö©Ìï¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ïûê ÎßûÏ∂§Ìòï Í≤∞Í≥ºÎ•º ÎèÑÏ∂úÌï©ÎãàÎã§. Îã®ÏàúÌûà Ï†ïÌï¥ÏßÑ ÎãµÎ≥ÄÏùÑ Ï£ºÎäî Í≤ÉÏù¥ ÏïÑÎãàÎùº, ÎåÄÌôî ÎÇ¥Ïö©ÏùÑ Ï¢ÖÌï©Ï†ÅÏúºÎ°ú Î∂ÑÏÑùÌïòÏó¨ Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏùò ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º ÏµúÎåÄÌïú Î∞òÏòÅÌïú Í≤∞Í≥ºÎ¨ºÏùÑ ÎÇ¥ÎÜìÏ£†.

Íµ¨Î∂Ñ ÌäπÏßï
ÌéòÎ•¥ÏÜåÎÇò ÏπúÏ†àÌïòÍ≥† ÌÜµÏ∞∞Î†• ÏûàÎäî AI Ïñ¥ÏãúÏä§ÌÑ¥Ìä∏ Ïó≠Ìï†
ÌïµÏã¨ Í∏∞Îä• ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ïûê ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ï†ÅÏù∏ 10Í∞ÄÏßÄ Í∞úÎ∞ú ÏöîÏ≤≠ÏúºÎ°ú Î≥ÄÌôò
ÎåÄÌôî Î∞©Ïãù Î™ÖÌôïÌïú 3Îã®Í≥Ñ ÏßàÎ¨∏ÏùÑ ÌÜµÌï¥ ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Íµ¨Ï°∞Ìôî
Í≤∞Í≥ºÎ¨º ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏ ÏÑ§Ï†ï, UI/UX, Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞ Í¥ÄÎ¶¨ Îì± Í∞úÎ∞úÏùò Ï†ÑÎ∞òÏ†ÅÏù∏ Ï∏°Î©¥ÏùÑ Îã§Î£∏

Ïù¥ Ï†¨ÏùÑ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎ©¥ Îçî Ïù¥ÏÉÅ "Î¨¥ÏóáÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ ÏãúÏûëÌï¥Ïïº Ìï†Íπå?"ÎùºÎäî Í≥†ÎØºÏóê ÏãúÍ∞ÑÏùÑ ÎÇ≠ÎπÑÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÏïÑÎèÑ Îê©ÎãàÎã§. Ïó¨Îü¨Î∂ÑÏù¥ Ï†úÍ≥µÌïú ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Î∞îÌÉïÏúºÎ°ú ÏΩîÎî©Ïùò Ï≤´ Î≤àÏß∏ Î°úÎìúÎßµÏùÑ Í∑∏Î†§Ï£ºÎãàÍπåÏöî!

 

Ïã§Ï†Ñ ÏòàÏãú: 'Í∞êÏ†ï ÏùºÍ∏∞ Ïï±' ÎπåÎçî ÏöîÏ≤≠

ÏòàÎ•º Îì§Ïñ¥, "Îß§ÏùºÏùò Í∏∞Î∂ÑÍ≥º ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÏùÑ Í∞ÑÎã®Ìïú Ïù¥Î™®Ìã∞ÏΩòÏúºÎ°ú Í∏∞Î°ùÌïòÎäî Í∞êÏ†ï ÏùºÍ∏∞ Ïï±"Ïù¥ÎùºÎäî ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î•º Ï†¨ÏóêÍ≤å Íµ¨Ï≤¥ÌôîÏãúÌÇ§Í≥† "ÎÑ§"ÎùºÍ≥† ÎåÄÎãµÌïòÎ©¥ Îã§ÏùåÍ≥º Í∞ôÏùÄ 10Í∞ÄÏßÄ ÎπåÎçî ÏöîÏ≤≠ÏùÑ Î∞õÏùÑ Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.

ÏÇ¨Î°Ä Ï£ºÏù∏Í≥µÏùò ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥

  • Ïï±Ïùò Ï†ïÏ≤¥ÏÑ±: Îß§ÏùºÏùò Í∞êÏ†ïÏùÑ Í∏∞Î°ùÌïòÎäî Í∞êÏ†ï ÏùºÍ∏∞ Ïï±
  • ÌïµÏã¨ Í∏∞Îä•: ÎÇ†ÏßúÎ≥ÑÎ°ú Ïù¥Î™®Ìã∞ÏΩòÍ≥º Ìïú Ï§Ñ Î©îÎ™®Î•º Ï†ÄÏû•
  • Ïï±Ïùò 'Î∞îÏù¥Î∏å': Îî∞ÎúªÌïòÍ≥† ÏïÑÍ∏∞ÏûêÍ∏∞Ìïú ÌååÏä§ÌÖîÌÜ§ ÎîîÏûêÏù∏

Ï†¨Ïù¥ ÏÉùÏÑ±Ìïú 10Í∞ÄÏßÄ ÎπåÎçî ÏöîÏ≤≠

  • 1. React NativeÏôÄ ExpoÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÏó¨ 'Í∞êÏ†ï ÏùºÍ∏∞' Ïï±Ïùò Í∏∞Î≥∏ ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏Î•º ÏÑ§Ï†ïÌï¥Ï§ò.
  • 2. Ïï±Ïùò Î©îÏù∏ Ïª¨Îü¨Îäî ÌååÏä§ÌÖîÌÜ§(#FFDDC1, #BEE3DB)ÏúºÎ°ú, Í∏∞Î≥∏ Ìè∞Ìä∏Îäî ÏÜêÍ∏ÄÏî® ÎäêÎÇåÏùò 'Gaegu' Ìè∞Ìä∏Î•º Ï†ÅÏö©Ìï¥Ï§ò.
  • 3. Firebase AuthenticationÏùÑ Ïù¥Ïö©Ìïú Ïù¥Î©îÏùº/ÎπÑÎ∞ÄÎ≤àÌò∏ Í∏∞Î∞òÏùò Í∞ÑÎã®Ìïú ÌöåÏõêÍ∞ÄÏûÖ Î∞è Î°úÍ∑∏Ïù∏ ÌôîÎ©¥ÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥Ï§ò.
  • 4. Î©îÏù∏ ÌôîÎ©¥ÏóêÎäî ÎÇ†ÏßúÎ•º ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎäî Ï∫òÎ¶∞Îçî UIÎ•º Íµ¨ÌòÑÌï¥Ï§ò. Í∞Å ÎÇ†ÏßúÏóêÎäî Í∑∏ÎÇ† Í∏∞Î°ùÌïú ÎåÄÌëú Ïù¥Î™®Ìã∞ÏΩòÏù¥ ÏûëÍ≤å ÌëúÏãúÎêòÏñ¥Ïïº Ìï¥.
  • 5. ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÏûêÍ∞Ä ÎÇ†ÏßúÎ•º ÌÉ≠ÌïòÎ©¥ Í∑∏ÎÇ†Ïùò Í∏∞Î°ùÏùÑ ÏûëÏÑ±ÌïòÎäî 'Í∏∞Î°ùÌïòÍ∏∞' Î™®Îã¨(Modal) Ï∞ΩÏùÑ ÎùÑÏõåÏ§ò.
  • 6. 'Í∏∞Î°ùÌïòÍ∏∞' Ï∞ΩÏóêÎäî 5Í∞ÄÏßÄ Í∞êÏ†ï(Í∏∞ÏÅ®, Ïä¨Ìîî, ÌôîÎÇ®, ÌèâÏò®, ÎÜÄÎûå)ÏùÑ ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇ¥Îäî Ïª§Ïä§ÌÖÄ Ïù¥Î™®Ìã∞ÏΩò Î≤ÑÌäºÏùÑ Ìè¨Ìï®Ìï¥Ï§ò.

posts.content:
Ï±ÖÏùÑ 'ÏùΩÎäî ÌñâÏúÑ'ÏóêÏÑú 'Ïã§Ï≤úÌïòÎäî ÏäµÍ¥Ä'ÏúºÎ°ú! ChatGPTÎ•º ÌôúÏö©Ìï¥ ÎÇòÎßåÏùò ÏûêÍ∏∞Í≥ÑÎ∞ú ÏõåÌÅ¨Î∂ÅÏùÑ ÎßåÎìúÎäî Íµ¨Ï≤¥Ï†ÅÏù∏ Î∞©Î≤ïÏùÑ ÏÜåÍ∞úÌï©ÎãàÎã§. Îçî Ïù¥ÏÉÅ Ï±ÖÏû•Ïóê ÍΩÇÏïÑÎëêÏßÄÎßå ÎßêÍ≥†, ÎÇ¥ ÏÇ∂Ïùò Î≥ÄÌôîÎ•º ÏúÑÌïú Ï≤´Í±∏ÏùåÏùÑ ÏãúÏûëÌï¥Î≥¥ÏÑ∏Ïöî.

 

ÏûêÍ∏∞Í≥ÑÎ∞úÏÑú, Ï¢ãÏïÑÌïòÏãúÎÇòÏöî? Ï†ÄÎèÑ Ï∞∏ Ï¢ãÏïÑÌïòÎäîÎç∞Ïöî, Ï¢ãÏùÄ Î¨∏Ïû•ÏùÑ Î∞úÍ≤¨ÌïòÎ©¥ Î∞ëÏ§ÑÏùÑ Í∏ãÍ≥†, Î©îÎ™®ÌïòÍ≥†, ÌòºÏûê Í∞êÌÉÑÍπåÏßÄ ÌïòÏ£†. Í∑ºÎç∞ Ïù¥ÏÉÅÌïòÍ≤åÎèÑ, Í∑∏Î†áÍ≤å Ïó¥Ïã¨Ìûà ÏùΩÏùÄ Ï±ÖÎì§Ïù¥ Ï†ú ÏÇ∂ÏùÑ ÏßÑÏßúÎ°ú Î∞îÍøîÏ§¨Îçò Ï†ÅÏùÄ Î≥ÑÎ°ú ÏóÜÏóàÎçò Í≤É Í∞ôÏïÑÏöî. Ïò§ÌûàÎ†§ ÏãúÍ∞ÑÏù¥ ÏßÄÎÇòÎ©¥ Ïñ¥Îñ§ Ï±ÖÏùÑ ÏùΩÏóàÎäîÏßÄ Í∞ÄÎ¨ºÍ∞ÄÎ¨ºÌï¥Ïßà ÎïåÍ∞Ä Îçî ÎßéÎçîÎùºÍ≥†Ïöî.

Í∑∏Îü¨Îçò Ïñ¥Îäê ÎÇ†, Ïö∞Ïó∞Ìûà Ïú†ÌäúÎ∏åÏóêÏÑú "Ï±ÖÏùÄ ÏùΩÎäî Í≤å ÏïÑÎãàÎùº Ïç®Ïïº ÎÇ¥ Í≤ÉÏù¥ ÎêúÎã§. ÏõåÌÅ¨Î∂ÅÏùÑ ÎßåÎì§Ïñ¥ Î≥¥ÏÑ∏Ïöî"ÎùºÎäî Ìïú ÌÅ¨Î¶¨ÏóêÏù¥ÌÑ∞Ïùò ÎßêÏùÑ Îì£Í≤å ÎêêÏäµÎãàÎã§. Ïù¥ ÌïúÎßàÎîîÍ∞Ä Î®∏Î¶øÏÜçÏùÑ ÏæÖ! ÌïòÍ≥† Ïö∏Î†∏Îã¨ÍπåÏöî? Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Ï†ÄÎäî Í∑∏ÎÇ†Î∂ÄÌÑ∞ Ï±Ö ÏÜç Î¨∏Ïû•Îì§ÏùÑ Î∞îÌÉïÏúºÎ°ú ÎÇòÎßåÏùò Ïã§Ï≤ú ÏõåÌÅ¨Î∂ÅÏùÑ ChatGPTÏôÄ Ìï®Íªò ÎßåÎì§Í∏∞ ÏãúÏûëÌñàÏñ¥Ïöî.

1. Ï±ÖÏùò ÌïµÏã¨ Î¨∏Ïû•ÏùÑ Ï†ïÎ¶¨ÌïòÍ∏∞

Í∞ÄÏû• Î®ºÏ†Ä ÏãúÏûëÌïú Ï±ÖÏùÄ ÍπÄÎØºÏãù PDÎãòÏùò Î≤†Ïä§Ìä∏ÏÖÄÎü¨, „ÄäÎß§Ïùº ÏïÑÏπ® Ïç®Î¥§Îãà„ÄãÏòÄÏñ¥Ïöî. Ï±Ö Ï†ÑÏ≤¥Î•º ÏöîÏïΩÌïòÎ†§Îäî Î∂ÄÎã¥ÏùÄ ÎÇ¥Î†§ÎÜìÍ≥†, Ï†úÍ∞Ä Ï†ïÎßê Ïù∏ÏÉÅ ÍπäÍ≤å ÏùΩÏùÄ Î¨∏Ïû•Îì§Îßå Îî∞Î°ú Î™®ÏïòÏ£†. Ï¢ÖÏù¥Ï±ÖÏù¥ÎùºÎ©¥ Ìè¨Ïä§Ìä∏ÏûáÏù¥ÎÇò Î∞ëÏ§Ñ, ÏÇ¨ÏßÑ Ï∞çÍ∏∞Î•º ÌôúÏö©Ìï¥ÎèÑ Ï¢ãÍ≥†, Ï†ÑÏûêÏ±ÖÏùÄ Î∞ÄÎ¶¨Ïùò ÏÑúÏû¨ÎÇò Î¶¨ÎîîÎ∂ÅÏä§Ïùò Î©îÎ™® Í∏∞Îä•ÏúºÎ°ú ÌïòÏù¥ÎùºÏù¥Ìä∏Î•º Ï†ïÎ¶¨Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏñ¥ÏÑú Ìé∏Ìï¥Ïöî.

Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å Î™®ÏùÄ Î¨∏Ïû•Îì§ÏùÑ Í∞ÄÏßÄÍ≥† ChatGPTÏóêÍ≤å Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å ÎßêÌñàÏñ¥Ïöî. "Ï†úÍ∞Ä Î∞ëÏ§Ñ Ïπú Î¨∏Ïû•ÏùÑ Í∞Å Ïû•Î≥ÑÎ°ú 3Í∞ÄÏßÄ ÌïµÏã¨ Ìè¨Ïù∏Ìä∏Î°ú ÏöîÏïΩÌï¥ Ï£ºÏÑ∏Ïöî." Ï±ïÌÑ∞Î≥ÑÎ°ú ÍπîÎÅîÌïòÍ≤å Ï†ïÎ¶¨Îêú ÏöîÏïΩÏùÑ Î∞õÏïÑÎ≥¥Îãà, Í∑∏ ÏïàÏóêÏÑú Ïã§Ï≤ú ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥Î°ú ÌôïÏû•Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏùÑ ÎßåÌïú Ìè¨Ïù∏Ìä∏Îì§Ïù¥ ÌïòÎÇòÎëòÏî© ÎààÏóê Îì§Ïñ¥Ïò§Í∏∞ ÏãúÏûëÌñàÏäµÎãàÎã§. ÏßÑÏßú Ïã†Í∏∞ÌïòÎçîÎùºÍ≥†Ïöî!

2. Í∞êÎ™Ö ÍπäÏùÄ Î¨∏Ïû•ÏóêÏÑú Ïã§Ï≤ú ÏïÑÏù¥ÎîîÏñ¥ ÎΩëÏïÑÎÇ¥Í∏∞

Ï±ÖÏùÑ ÏùΩÏúºÎ©∞ Í∞ÄÏû• ÎßàÏùåÏóê ÎÇ®ÏïòÎçò Î¨∏Ïû•ÏùÄ Î∞îÎ°ú "Í∏ÄÏùÑ Ïì∞Îäî ÏÇ¨ÎûåÏùÄ Îß§Ïùº ÏûêÏã†ÏùÑ Ìé∏ÏßëÌï¥ ÎÇòÍ∞ÄÎäî ÏÇ¨ÎûåÏù¥Îã§."ÏòÄÏñ¥Ïöî. Ïù¥ Î¨∏Ïû•ÏùÑ Î≥¥Îäî ÏàúÍ∞Ñ, 'ÎÇòÎèÑ Îß§Ïùº ÎÇòÎ•º Ï°∞Í∏àÏî© Ìé∏ÏßëÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏùÑÍπå?' ÌïòÎäî ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÏù¥ Îì§ÏóàÏ£†. Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Î∞îÎ°ú ChatGPTÏóêÍ≤å Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å Î¨ºÏñ¥Î¥§ÏäµÎãàÎã§.

ChatGPT ÌîÑÎ°¨ÌîÑÌä∏ ÏòàÏãú

"Ïù¥ Î¨∏Ïû•(‘Í∏ÄÏùÑ Ïì∞Îäî ÏÇ¨ÎûåÏùÄ Îß§Ïùº ÏûêÏã†ÏùÑ Ìé∏ÏßëÌï¥ ÎÇòÍ∞ÄÎäî ÏÇ¨ÎûåÏù¥Îã§’)ÏùÑ Î∞îÌÉïÏúºÎ°ú Ï†úÍ∞Ä ÏùºÏÉÅÏóêÏÑú Ïã§Ï≤úÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎäî 3Í∞ÄÏßÄ Î∞©Î≤ïÏùÑ ÏïåÎ†§Ï£ºÏÑ∏Ïöî."

ÏùºÎã® Ïù¥ Ïî®Îì§Ïù¥ Ïûò ÏûêÎùºÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌïú ÌïÑÏàò ÏöîÏÜåÏù∏ Î¨ºÍ≥º ÌÜ†ÏñëÏùÄ VCÎì§Ïù¥ Ï†úÍ≥µÌïòÎäî ÏûêÍ∏àÏù¥Îã§. Ïî®ÏïóÏù¥ ÏûêÎùºÏÑú ÌÅ∞ ÎÇòÎ¨¥Í∞Ä ÎêòÎ†§Î©¥ ÎçîÏö±Îçî ÎßéÏùÄ ÏàòÎ∂ÑÏù¥ ÌïÑÏöîÌïòÍ≥†, Îçî ÎßéÏùÄ ÏòÅÏñëÏÜåÍ∞Ä ÏãúÍ∏∞Ï†ÅÏ†àÌïòÍ≤å ÌïÑÏöîÌïúÎç∞, Ïä§ÌÉÄÌä∏ÏóÖÏù¥ ÏÑ±Ïû•ÌïòÎ†§Î©¥ Îçî ÎßéÏùÄ ÏûêÍ∏àÏù¥ ÌïÑÏöîÌïú Í≤ÉÍ≥º ÎπÑÏä∑ÌïòÎã§Í≥† Î≥¥Î©¥ ÎêúÎã§.
Î¨ºÍ≥º ÎπÑÎ£åÎäî ÎÜçÎ∂ÄÍ∞Ä Ï†úÍ≥µÌï† ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÎã§. ÌïòÏßÄÎßå, Ïî®ÏïóÏù¥ ÎÇòÎ¨¥Í∞Ä ÎêòÍ∏∞ ÏúÑÌï¥ÏÑ† Ïù¥ Ïô∏ÏóêÎèÑ ÎßéÏùÄ Í≤å ÌïÑÏöîÌïòÎã§. ÎπÑÎèÑ ÏôÄÏïº ÌïòÍ≥†, Ï∂©Î∂ÑÌïú ÌñáÎπõÎèÑ ÌïÑÏöîÌïòÍ≥†, Î∞îÎûåÎèÑ Î∂àÏñ¥Ïïº ÌïòÎäîÎç∞ ÎÇ†Ïî®Îäî ÎÜçÎ∂ÄÍ∞Ä Ïª®Ìä∏Î°§Ìï† Ïàò ÏóÜÎäî ÏãúÏû• ÏÉÅÌô©Í≥º ÎπÑÏä∑ÌïòÎã§. Ïú†ÎèôÏÑ±Ïù¥ ÌíçÎ∂ÄÌï¥ÏÑú Ìà¨ÏûêÎ•º Ïûò Î∞õÎäî ÏãúÏû• ÌôòÍ≤ΩÏù¥ ÏûàÎäîÍ∞Ä ÌïòÎ©¥, ÏµúÍ∑º Î™á ÎÖÑÍ≥º Í∞ôÏù¥ ÎèàÏù¥ ÎßêÎùºÏÑú Í∞ÄÎ≠ÑÏù∏ ÌôòÍ≤ΩÎèÑ ÏûàÎäîÎç∞, Ïù¥Í±¥ Ïö∞Î¶¨Í∞Ä Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å Ìï† Ïàò ÏóÜÏñ¥ÏÑú Í∑∏ÎïåÎßàÎã§ ÏãúÏû• ÏÉÅÌô©Ïóê Îî∞ÎùºÏÑú Ï†ÅÏùëÌïòÍ≥† Ï°∞Ï†àÌï¥Ïïº ÌïúÎã§. ÏïÑÎ¨¥Î¶¨ ÎÖ∏Î†®Ìïú ÎÜçÎ∂ÄÎèÑ Ìï≠ÏÉÅ ÌíçÎÖÑÎßå Í≤ΩÌóòÌïòÎäî Í≤å ÏïÑÎãàÎã§. ÎÜçÏÇ¨ÌïòÎã§ Î≥¥Î©¥ ÎÇ†Ïî®ÏôÄ Í∞ôÏùÄ Ïó¨Îü¨ Í∞ÄÏßÄ Ïô∏Î∂Ä ÏöîÏÜå ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê ÌíçÎÖÑÍ≥º ÌùâÎÖÑÏùÑ Î≤àÍ∞àÏïÑ Í≤ΩÌóòÌïòÎäîÎç∞, ÎÖ∏Î†®Ìïú ÎÜçÎ∂ÄÎäî Ïù¥ÎïåÎßàÎã§ Ïûò Ï†ÅÏùëÌïòÍ≥† Ï°∞Ï†àÌïúÎã§.
ÎÜçÎ∂ÄÏùò ÎßàÏùåÏúºÎ°ú ÎøåÎ¶∞ Ïî®Í∞Ä Ïûò ÏûêÎùºÍ∏∏ Í∞ÑÏ†àÌûà Î∞îÎùºÏßÄÎßå, ÏÜîÏßÅÌûà Ïù¥ Ï§ë Ïñ¥Îñ§ Ïî®ÏïóÏù¥ ÏÉùÏ°¥Ìï¥ÏÑú ÌÅ∞ ÎÇòÎ¨¥Í∞Ä Îê† ÏßÑ ÏïÑÎ¨¥ÎèÑ Î™®Î•∏Îã§. Ïû¨Ïàò ÏóÜÎäî ÌùâÎÖÑÏù¥Î©¥ Î™®Îì† Ïî®ÏïóÏù¥ Ï†ÑÎ©∏ÌïòÍ≥†, ÌÜ†ÏñëÏù¥ Ïò§ÏóºÎêòÍ±∞ÎÇò ÎπÑÍ∞Ä ÎÑàÎ¨¥ ÎßéÏù¥ Ïò§Í±∞ÎÇò, Î∂ÄÏ°±ÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò, ÎòêÎäî ÌñáÎπõÏù¥ Î∂ÄÏ°±ÌïòÎ©¥ Ïî®Îäî ÏûëÏùÄ ÎÇòÎ¨¥ÏóêÏÑú ÏÑ±Ïû•ÏùÑ Î©àÏ∂òÎã§. ÌïòÏßÄÎßå, Î™®Îì† Í≤å Ïûò ÎßûÏïÑÎñ®Ïñ¥ÏßÄÎ©¥, ÏãúÍ∞ÑÏù¥ ÏßÄÎÇòÎ©¥ÏÑú Ïî®ÏïóÏóêÎèÑ Î≥µÎ¶¨Ïùò ÌûòÏù¥ ÏûëÏö©ÌïòÍ≥†, ÏûëÏùÄ Ïî®ÏïóÏù¥ ÏóÑÏ≤≠ÎÇòÍ≤å ÌäºÌäºÌïòÍ≥† ÌÅ∞ ÎÇòÎ¨¥Î°ú ÏûêÎùºÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞ÎèÑ ÏûàÎã§. Î¨ºÎ°†, Ïù¥Îü∞ ÌöåÏÇ¨Îì§ÏùÄ ÏïÑÏõÉÎùºÏù¥Ïñ¥Îã§. ÏùºÎã® Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å ÎÇòÎ¨¥Í∞Ä Î¨¥Îü≠Î¨¥Îü≠ ÏûêÎùºÎ†§Î©¥ ÏãúÍ∞ÑÏù¥ ÏóÑÏ≤≠ ÎßéÏù¥ Í±∏Î¶¨Í≥† Í∑∏ Í∏¥ Í∏∞Í∞Ñ ÎèôÏïà Ïù¥ ÎÇòÎ¨¥Í∞Ä Ï§ëÍ∞ÑÏóê Ï£ΩÏùÑ Ïàò ÏûàÎäî ÏàòÎ∞±Îßå Í∞ÄÏßÄÏùò ÏùºÎì§Ïù¥ ÏùºÏñ¥ÎÇ† Ïàò ÏûàÎã§. ÎÜçÎ∂ÄÎäî Îß§Ïùº ÏùºÏñ¥ÎÇòÏÑú ÌïòÎäòÏùÑ Î≥¥Î©¥ÏÑú ÎÇ†Ïî®Î•º ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÍ≥†, ÎÇòÎ≠áÏûéÏùÑ ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÍ≥†, Î¨ºÏùÑ Ï£ºÍ≥†, Ìï¥Ï∂©ÏùÑ Ï£ΩÏù¥Í≥†, Ï†ïÍ∏∞Ï†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÌÜ†ÏñëÏùÑ ÍµêÏ≤¥Ìï¥ Ï§ÄÎã§. ÎßàÏπò Ïö∞Î¶¨Í∞Ä Í≤ΩÍ∏∞Ïùò Îß•ÏùÑ ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÍ≥†, Ìà¨ÏûêÏÇ¨Ïùò ÌòÑÍ∏àÌùêÎ¶ÑÏùÑ ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÍ≥†, KPIÎ•º ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÍ≥†, Ï∞ΩÏóÖÍ∞ÄÏùò Ï†ïÏã† ÏÉÅÌÉúÎ•º ÌôïÏù∏ÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÍ≥º ÎπÑÏä∑Ìïú Í≤É Í∞ôÎã§.
Í∞ÄÎÅîÏùÄ Ïò§Îû´ÎèôÏïà ÏÉàÏãπÏù¥ Ïïà Ïò¨ÎùºÏôÄÏÑú Ï£ΩÏùÄ Ï§Ñ ÏïåÍ≥† Î∞©ÏπòÌïòÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞ÎèÑ ÏûàÎã§. Î¨ºÎèÑ Ïïà Ï£ºÍ≥†, ÎπÑÎ£åÎèÑ Ïïà Ï£ºÎäîÎç∞, Ïñ¥Îäê ÎÇ† Î∞≠Ïóê Í∞ÄÎ≥¥ÎãàÍπå Ïû°Ï¥àÍ∞ôÏù¥ Ïûò ÏûêÎùºÏÑú ÏïÑÏ£º ÌÅ∞ ÎÇòÎ¨¥Í∞Ä ÎêòÎäî Í≤ΩÏö∞ÎèÑ ÏûàÎã§. ÌÅ¨Í≤å Í∏∞ÎåÄÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÏïòÍ≥†, ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏùÑ Ïûò Î™ª Ìï¥ÏÑú Î≥ÑÎ°ú Ïã†Í≤Ω Ïì∞ÏßÄ ÏïäÍ±∞ÎÇò, ÏÜêÏã§ Ï≤òÎ¶¨Ìïú ÌöåÏÇ¨Í∞Ä Í∞ëÏûêÍ∏∞ ÏóÑÏ≤≠ÎÇòÍ≤å Îπ†Î•¥Í≤å ÏÑ±Ïû•ÌïòÍ≥†, ÏïÑÏ£º Ï¢ãÏùÄ VCÏóêÍ≤å ÌõÑÏÜç Ìà¨ÏûêÎ•º Î∞õÎäî Í≤å Ïù¥Îü∞ Í≤ΩÏö∞Îã§. ÏÜîÏßÅÌûà Ïö∞Î¶¨ÎèÑ Ïù¥Îü∞ Ïû°Ï¥àÏùò ÏºÄÏù¥Ïä§Î•º Î™á Î≤à Í≤ΩÌóòÌñàÎäîÎç∞, ÏïÑÏ£º Í∏∞Î∂ÑÏù¥ Ï¢ãÎã§. Ïù¥Îü∞ Í≤ΩÏö∞Í∞Ä Îçî ÎßéÏúºÎ©¥ Ï¢ãÍ≤†Îã§.
Ï∞∏Í≥†Î°ú, Ïö∞Î¶¨Í∞ôÏù¥ ÎßéÏùÄ Ïä§ÌÉÄÌä∏ÏóÖÏóê Ìà¨ÏûêÌïòÎäî Î™®Îç∏ÏùÑ ÎØ∏Íµ≠ÏóêÏÑúÎäî ‚Äòspray and pray‚Äô Î™®Îç∏Ïù¥ÎùºÍ≥† ÌïúÎã§. ÎßéÏù¥ ÎøåÎ¶¨Í≥†, Ïù¥ Ï§ë Î™á Í∞úÍ∞Ä Ïûò ÎêòÍ∏∏ Í∏∞ÎèÑÌïúÎã§Îäî ÏùòÎØ∏Ïù∏Îç∞, ÎåÄÌôîÏùò Ïª®ÌÖçÏä§Ìä∏Ïóê Îî∞ÎùºÏÑú ÎßéÏù¥ Ìà¨ÏûêÌïòÍ≥† Î¨¥Ï±ÖÏûÑÌïòÍ≤å Í∏∞ÎèÑÎßå ÌïòÎäî ÎèÑÎ∞ïÏù¥ÎùºÎäî Î∂ÄÏ†ïÏ†ÅÏù∏ ÏùòÎØ∏Ïùº ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÍ≥†, ÎßéÏù¥ Ìà¨ÏûêÌïòÍ≥† Ïó¥Ïã¨Ìûà Í∏∞ÎèÑÌïúÎã§Îäî(=ÎèÑÏôÄÏ§ÄÎã§Îäî) Í∏çÏ†ïÏ†ÅÏù∏ ÏùòÎØ∏Í∞Ä Îê† ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÎã§. ÎÇòÎäî Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Ìï≠ÏÉÅ ÎÜçÎã¥Ï≤òÎüº ‚ÄúÏö∞Î¶∞ spray and prayÎ•º ÌïòÎäîÎç∞, ÎÇòÎäî pray ÌïòÎäîÎç∞ Îçî ÎßéÏùÄ ÏãúÍ∞ÑÏùÑ Î≥¥ÎÇ∏Îã§.‚ÄùÎùºÍ≥†ÎèÑ ÌïúÎã§. Í∑∏ÎßåÌÅº Ïñ¥Îñ§ ÌöåÏÇ¨Í∞Ä Ïûò Îê†ÏßÄ ÏïÑÎ¨¥ÎèÑ Î™®Î•¥Í≥†, ÏõåÎÇô Ï¥àÍ∏∞ ÌöåÏÇ¨ÎùºÏÑú VCÍ∞Ä ÏïÑÎ¨¥Î¶¨ Ïù¥ ÌöåÏÇ¨Îì§ÏùÑ ÎèÑÏôÄÏ§òÎèÑ Í∑∏ Í≤∞Í≥ºÎäî Ìï≠ÏÉÅ Î∂àÌôïÏã§ÌïòÎã§Îäî ÏùòÎØ∏Ïù¥Í∏∞ÎèÑ ÌïòÎã§.
Ïò§ÎäòÎèÑ Ïó¥Ïã¨Ìûà ÏùºÌïòÎü¨ Î∞≠ÏúºÎ°ú Ìñ•ÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÍ≥†, Í∏∞ÎèÑÎèÑ ÎßéÏù¥ ÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÎã§.

posts.content:encodedSnippet:
Î∞îÎ°ú Ïù¥Ï†Ñ Ìè¨Ïä§ÌåÖÏóê Ïù¥Ïñ¥ ÎπÑÏä∑Ìïú Îß•ÎùΩÏùò Í∏ÄÏùÑ Îòê Ïç®Î≥∏Îã§.
Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÎäî Ïó¨Í±¥Ïù¥ ÎêòÎäîÎç∞ÎèÑ ÎëêÎ†§ÏõÄÍ≥º Îß§ÎÑàÎ¶¨Ï¶ò ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê Íµ≠ÎèÑÏóêÏÑú Í≥†ÏÜçÎèÑÎ°úÎ°ú ÏßÑÏûÖÌïòÏßÄ Î™ªÌïòÎäî ÎßéÏùÄ ÌöåÏÇ¨Îì§ÏùÄ Ïñ∏Ï††Í∞ÄÎäî ÎßùÌï† ÌôïÎ•†Ïù¥ ÎÜíÎã§. Ï¢ãÏùÄ ÎπÑÏ¶àÎãàÏä§ Î™®Îç∏ÏùÑ Ï∞æÏïÑÏÑú ÎèàÏùÑ Î≤ÑÎäî ÏÇ¨ÏóÖ Íµ¨Ï°∞Î•º ÎßåÎì§Í∏¥ ÌñàÏßÄÎßå, Ïù¥ ÏÉÅÌô©ÏóêÏÑúÎäî ÏàòÏùµÏÑ±Ïù¥ ÏóÑÏ≤≠ÎÇòÍ≤å Ï¢ãÏßÑ ÏïäÏùÑ Í≤ÉÏù¥Í≥†, Ïù¥Îü∞ ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏùÄ ÎÑàÎ¨¥ÎÇò Îã§ÏñëÌïú ÎÇ¥, Ïô∏Î∂Ä ÏöîÏÜåÏùò Î≥ÄÌôîÏóê ÎåÄÌïú Î©¥Ïó≠Î†•Ïù¥ Îñ®Ïñ¥ÏßÄÍ∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïù¥Îã§. Í∞ëÏûêÍ∏∞ ÎèàÏù¥ ÎßéÏùÄ Í≤ΩÏüÅÏÇ¨Í∞Ä ÏãúÏû•Ïóê ÎÇòÌÉÄÎÇòÏÑú ÏãúÏû•Ï†êÏú†Ïú®ÏùÑ Î∫êÏùÑ ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÍ≥†, ÏßÅÏõêÎì§Ïù¥ ÎåÄÍ±∞ Ìá¥ÏÇ¨ÌïòÎ©¥ÏÑú ÎßâÎåÄÌïú Ìá¥ÏßÅÍ∏àÏúºÎ°ú ÌöåÎ≥µÌï† Ïàò ÏóÜÎäî ÏàòÏ§ÄÏúºÎ°ú ÎπÑÏö©Ïù¥ Ï¶ùÍ∞ÄÌï† ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÍ≥†, ÏùòÏ°¥ÌïòÎçò Ïú†ÌÜµ Ï±ÑÎÑêÏóê ÌÅ∞ Î≥ÄÌôîÍ∞Ä ÏÉùÍ∏∏ ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÍ≥†, Í∑∏ÎÉ• ÎÑàÎ¨¥ ÏÑ±Ïû•Ïù¥ ÏóÜÏñ¥ÏÑú ÏßÅÏõêÎì§Ïù¥ ÌïòÎÇòÎëòÏî© Îñ†ÎÇòÎ©¥ÏÑú ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏùò Í∑úÎ™®Í∞Ä Ï™ºÍ∑∏ÎùºÎì§ ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÎã§.
ÎòêÌïú, Ïù¥Îü∞ ÎπÑÏ¶àÎãàÏä§Îäî ÏúÑÏóêÏÑú ÎßêÌïú ÎåÄÎ°ú Î©¥Ïó≠Î†•Ïù¥ Í∑∏Î†áÍ≤å ÎÜíÏßÄ ÏïäÍ∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê, Îß§Î≤à, Îß§Îã¨, Îß§ÎÖÑ ÌùëÏûêÎ•º ÎÇ¥ÏßÑ Î™ªÌï† Í≤ÉÏù¥Îã§. Ïñ¥Îñ§ Îã¨ÏùÄ ÏÇ¥Ïßù Ï†ÅÏûêÍ∞Ä ÎÇ† ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÍ≥†, Ïñ¥Îñ§ Îã¨ÏùÄ ÏùºÌöåÏÑ± ÎπÑÏö©Ïù¥ Ìôï Ï¶ùÍ∞ÄÌï† ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÎã§. ÎòêÌïú, ÌòÑÍ∏à Î≥¥Ïú†ÎüâÏùÄ Í≥ÑÏÜç Ïú†ÏßÄÎêòÍ±∞ÎÇò, Ï°∞Í∏àÏî© Ï¶ùÍ∞ÄÌï† ÏàòÎèÑ ÏûàÏßÄÎßå, Î¨ºÍ∞ÄÏÉÅÏäπÎ•†ÏùÑ Í≥†Î†§ÌñàÏùÑ Îïå ÏûÑÏßÅÏõêÎì§Ïùò Ïó∞Î¥âÎèÑ Í∞ôÏù¥ Ïò¨ÎùºÏïº ÌïòÎäîÎç∞, ÏÑ±Ïû• ÏóÜÏù¥ ÌòÑ ÏÉÅÌÉúÏóêÏÑú Ïù¥Í≤ÉÏ†ÄÍ≤É ÎßûÏ∂îÎã§ Î≥¥Î©¥ ÏÑúÏÑúÌûà ÎπÑÏ¶àÎãàÏä§Îäî Ï§ÑÏñ¥Îì§ Í≤ÉÏù¥Îã§. Ïù¥Îü∞ ÏÉÅÌô©ÏóêÏÑú Í∞ëÏûêÍ∏∞ ÏÉàÎ°úÏö¥ Í≤ΩÏüÅÏÇ¨Í∞Ä Ï∂úÌòÑÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò, ÎåÄÍ∏∞ÏóÖÏù¥ Ïù¥ ÏãúÏû•ÏúºÎ°ú ÏßÑÏûÖÌïòÎ©¥, Î©¥Ïó≠Î†•Ïù¥ ÏïΩÌïú ÏÇ¨ÎûåÏù¥ Îã®Ïàú Í∞êÍ∏∞ ÌÉìÏóê ÏÇ¨ÎßùÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎìØÏù¥, Ïù¥ ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏùÄ Ìïú Î∞©Ïóê ÎßùÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÎã§.
Ï¶â, Í≥ÑÏÜç Íµ≠ÎèÑÎ°úÎßå Í∞ÄÎã§ Î≥¥Î©¥, ÏòÅÏñ¥Î°ú ÎßêÌïòÎäî slow deathÎ•º ÎßûÏù¥Ìï† ÌôïÎ•†Ïù¥ Îß§Ïö∞ ÎÜíÎã§. Í∑∏ ÏÜçÎèÑÍ∞Ä ÎÑàÎ¨¥ ÎäêÎ†§ÏÑú Ïûò Î™ª ÎäêÎÇÑ ÎøêÏù¥ÏßÄ, ÏãúÍ∞ÑÏù¥ Í∞àÏàòÎ°ù Ïù¥ ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÏùÄ Ï≤úÏ≤úÌûà Ïπ®Î™∞ÌïòÎäî Î∞∞ÏôÄ Í∞ôÏù¥ Ï≤úÏ≤úÌûà ÏÜçÎ†•Ïù¥ Ï§ÑÏñ¥ÏÑú Î©àÏ∂ú Í≤ÉÏù¥Îã§. Ïö∞Î¶¨ ÏÇ¨ÏóÖÎèÑ ÌòÑÏû¨ ÎäêÎ¶¨Í≤å Ï£ΩÍ≥† ÏûàÎã§Î©¥, ÎåÄÌëúÎì§ÏùÄ ÏïÑÏ£º Í≥ºÍ∞êÌïú Í≤∞Ï†ïÏùÑ ÎÇ¥Î¶¥ ÌïÑÏöîÍ∞Ä ÏûàÎã§. Ï¶â, Îπ®Î¶¨ Í≥†ÏÜçÎèÑÎ°úÎ°ú ÏßÑÏûÖÌï¥Ïïº ÌïúÎã§.
